description:
Very good deal both in moderate pricing and large chunks of fairly freshly fish- except for the salmon. Maybe it was a day old, who knows, but I eat a lot of salmon sashimi and this batch was noticeably mealy. The other varieties of fish in my sashimi were good! Oh, the shrimp (ebi) was incredibly, almost unbelievably small, and marinated in too much "sweet".

Overall I think it's a great deal and I'll order again! (Next time sit-down with my shiny new Groupon coupon!)

Bòñ Æppeťi!
author: Grizzle J.

description:
Phenomenal place to grab fresh sashimi! We got the Romeo & Juliet roll topped with the best scallop sashimi. Would definitely get this roll over and over again!

We also got nigiri amaebi with the fried head included, uni, tuna, and sea bass special. 

Pretty reasonably priced, especially for San Francisco.
author: Miranda N.

description:
Wanted to try this place for 2 reasons. Groupon and they had no rice sushi rolls. Husband and I came here on a weeknight and place wasn't busy at all. 
We ordered sashimi, sushi rolls and chicken karaage. It was pretty good. 
Our only concern was that night, hubby and I both had stomachache and ended up in the bathroom. It wasn't a really bad food poisoning but it was still uncomfortable.
author: Claire J.

description:
I just ordered delivery from here for the first time today and I was happily surprised at the quality and portion size. The fish was so incredibly fresh. I ordered sashimi and two rolls (yes I eat a lot and used the $30 delivery minimum as an excuse).

Considering my sushi addiction, I can imagine this becoming a weekly habit. I told my coworkers about how good it was and we're likely to combine financial resources and try one of their platters next time.
author: Tanya W.

description: I loved the fish! Super fresh! It melts in your mouth! We got rainbow roll, very good size for just $11! Sushi dinner plate and a couple of normal rolls that are on the small size but delicious! Especially with Groupon the value was Amazing!! Service was also good!
author: Greta V.

description:
Fantastic sushi! Very pleased, I plan on coming again 
Glad that Groupon had the $30 voucher for only $17.50!
author: Nancy G.

description: Annie and Lee, sitting next to us frequently here said to get fish tacos, fab on crispy seaweed, also went for crunchy lobster roll and dragon roll, all is good here, can't rave enough, wonderful staff, tonight we had Andy, so gracious, warm and explained real well.  This is our 3rd time here and will definitely return. Freshest fish and inviting ambience. Not noisy and always meet best neighbors.
author: Ellen L.

description:
Fresh fish in large slices. That's more than half of what I'm looking for when I check out a new sushi spot. The flavor profiles weren't quite there (as in, the salmon wasn't super salmony) but you felt like you were getting your money's worth in terms of size. 

Slices were about 2 inches long and a 1/2 inch thick. The chirashi came with 2 slices of 5 types of fish-- the selection that day was salmon, tuna (perfect red color, not fishy at all), the hamachi fell apart a bit, another pink type of fish (not sure which) was also tasty and held together more firmly, and the escolar was pretty standard. They topped the bowl with a sprinkling of ikura (the salty kind, though not quite seawater level).

Mainstream complaints of the wasabi and ginger being too close to the fish, but that's every sushi takeout ever. I'll be back!
author: Nicole H.

description: A Richmond district staple, been here too many times to count. The owner and waitress always takes care of us, $28 omakase is hard to beat. Great variety as long as you know what to order. Whether you come by yourself or a big party, this is the Richmond spot
author: Panchali S.

description: You know that donut shop I just reviewed on Geary? Well this is the sushi spot that we found on Groupon that was amazing that I referenced in that review. Geary is really a great street, tons of good bars and restaurants on that long strip of road. The golden donut was all right, but they stay open until midnight which is pretty sweet. The hogshead dive bar, one of the better in the city that we have found so far, also on Geary. But back to sushi:) This sushi spot is close quarters, not a lot of breathing room but the quality of the fish was excellent. I'd like to fancy myself somewhat of a sushi snob so I would highly recommend hitting this place, hopefully with a Groupon if they're still running their promotion, and giving them a try. And what made it even more exciting was that we sat next to an older gentleman that had multiple large bottles of sake all around his seating area that decided to tell me how good-looking and voluptuous I was when my husband went to the bathroom. Told me he's been living in San Francisco since the 70s, since the sexual revolution he said. San Francisco is literally a city all made up of every type of person you can imagine, you have a different neighborhood on every block, the most unique city I've ever been in hands down. You just never know what's gonna happen when visiting good old city by the bay..lol
author: Prescila B.

description:
Forgot I had ordered from here before and was disappointed so very upset at myself for making that mistake again. This time, I ordered the curry udon. There were no indications of it being vegetarian but also none of it having meat. I hoped for the latter as it is the curry udon that I am accustomed to but unfortunately not. I also ordered 3 rolls; the spicy scallop, the salmon skin and the spicy tuna. The spicy scallop was best and the spicy tuna was worst. Spicy tuna was old fish covered in sauce but it was obvious fish was old; it was brown instead of reddish and it didn't hold together. The salmon skin roll was alright. 

Never order from here again. Must remember.
author: Hello E.

description: Consistently delicious & generous portions of crafted sushi: Crunchy Lobster Rolls & Fish Tacos are not to be missed!! Just terrific!
author: Marc L.

description: This place gets pretty busy on weekends so when it does make sure you are ready to wait because there seems to be only one waitress taking orders and another helping with bringing out the food. The food is really good and fresh! My mom always gets the seafood udon and she loves it! Their sushi taste great and the presentation is on point!
author: Linda N.

description: We came here to use our groupon that was about to expire and I have to say we made the right decision. On the outside it doesn't look like much, almost like it was closed, but when you get inside it's really nice with the wood paneling and the lighting. Once seated, we saw that they had a variety of different rolls that could be ordered which included what we ended up getting which was the Romeo and Juliet ( a roll that was wrapped in soy paper and had salmon and avocado), the volcano and also the yakitori pork belly and the miso soup. I highly recommend to try the volcano roll which with presentation alone is deserves to be ordered and the yakitori was pretty good as well. The miso and the Romeo and Juliet was just ok, in my opinion, but my partner really seemed to like it. I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Desiree C.

description:
Features:
-We came here yesterday because we bought a Groupon deal, $16 for $30 worth of sushi.  We made reservations for 6pm and were seated right away.  
-Our waitress was very efficient and took our orders.  We had four orders: salmon with scallops roll, jalapeno Hamachi roll, salmon belly sashimi (4 pieces) and the lobster roll.  I really loved the salmon belly sashimi, I ate my pieces so fast that I forgot to initially take pictures of them.  They were fresh and slid off my tongue type of delicious.  The lobster roll was my second favorite because it was very flavorful.  My mouth was in shock with so many different flavors--from sweet to spicy.  I especially liked the crunchy stuff atop.  The salmon with scallops was good but more on the plain side for me despite the fact that they added some flavor on top (Sriracha I believe).  The jalapeno Hamachi was my least favorite, it had way too much rice rolled up on the sides and very less fish.  It had so much rice that I barely tasted any fish.  What stood out more was the jalapeno as the main taste.  

Improvement:
-The jalapeno Hamachi roll came out last and very late.  We finished all our food and maybe waited about a good ten minutes before this came out.  I would recommend this roll come out with the others.

Tips:
-I would come here again with the Groupon deal.  
-I looked at the omakase orders and they looked reasonably price.  The next time I come, I would love to try the omakase!
-Cash and credit cards accepted.
-Very fast service.
-There were several TVs so you won't miss any sports games, FYI.
author: Kristy L.

description:
I appreciate this sushi spot on what it offers as their theme!  

Testing the waters at this semi-casual place and let's just say that the dining experience passed splendidly.  (I think it was the sake shots, maybe.)

Off menu, do order their daily special whole fish sashimi.  It's a wonder to the eyes and awesome for the sashimi lovers!

One must get their spoonful of Midnight oyster with quail egg, uni and ikura in ponzu sauce.  It's a great opening appetizer.

They have creative and delectable dishes here. Taco salmon was yum and different.  Rolls were of nice variety.  Hamachi tataki was delicious.  

Sake was pleasantly milky-like and smooth.

Service was attentive and they even gave us a complimentary dish near the end. 

Will return!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Thank Groupon for the first time visit. Service staff is friendly and we were seated immediately on a Sat evening. Waitresses were quick to meet needs and the orders were fulfilled without much of a wait. A bar and seated table area is present. Towards the back, tables are available for larger groups. Menu is diverse with appetizers, sushi, rice, and noodle dishes. Prices are reasonable relative to portion size and taste. Overall, the food is tasty, good portion and the end result is a satisfying meal in a nice casual place with good service. Grab a coupon or not and try this spot.
author: David H.

description:
Last minute decision brought us here for sushi. We ended up with Oyako Donburi and mixed Tempura appetizer and the Temptation roll. The husband enjoyed the donburi, but nothing outstanding about it. The mixed Tempura was a stingy portion (only 2 previously cooked prawns) and cooked slightly not hot enough - it came out greasy. The ponzu sauce tasted more like beef broth, and mostly tasteless. The Temptation roll had all of my favorite elements: crab, unagi, avocado, etc. but it was rolled too loosely and too large. It fell apart as soon as I tried to pick it up. Our server was very sweet and a little overworked. The bill was $40 with the tip.

All in all, not a wow. It was good on a Saturday afternoon in a pinch.
author: Marty R.

description:
Found Arashi thanks to Groupon. I love sushi, & not only was everything delicious, I've never had such large slices of high quality fish.
I ordered the blue fin tuna, as it's not usually available. Lots of grilled items, I had skewers of eggplant & shrimp. The menu had plenty vegetarian items. They appear to have a large take-out business.The interior is a great combo of casual & class. The tables are good for 1-4 people. And there's always the bar. Along the back is a tv showing sports, thankfully high up with the sound off.
author: Lynn F.

description:
I'm not 100 percent certain this place is truly Japanese. First of all, the ebi tempura rolls had tough soggy cold tempura inside.  Granted it's a roll, but usually it's more warm or fresh.  Secondly, the nigiri wasn't made with actual sushi rice.  Wrong texture and taste.  Third was the agedashi tofu. I have never in my life seen the grainy hard tofu used instead of the silky tofu.  I thought it had curdled or gone bad.  When I inquired about this with the waitress, she didn't know what kind of tofu was actually used and had to ask st the kitchen.  It was actually gross.  The clincher of the whole evening was that she didn't offer to refund or exchange this weird tofu for something else.  I feel like an authentic restaurant would have been upset or embarrassed about the gross tofu and made it right.  I know the culture - I've been to Japan.

On the way out, my friend commented that maybe the restaurant was part of the motel next door, because it tasted like bad hotel food
author: Max G.

description:
Came here for lunch because my boyfriend and I had an expiring Groupon to use. The service was decent but the food here was pretty average. We ordered the chicken karage that had a good batter, but was a little salty. We ordered the Giants Roll and the Wagyu Roll that oddly came out looking very similar (with a bunch of raw onions), which was not indicated on the menu descriptions. The regular sized sashimi was okay in terms of freshness, but the cuts were really thick.

Maybe we went on an off day but I wasn't very impressed.
author: Karen T.

description:
Highly recommend this place! A gf recommended it; it's a place she goes often. So we came here together one night, and she was right - I loved it!

Everything I had was delish - salmon maki, hamachi maki, tuna maki, and the midnight oyster shooters (uni, quail egg, oyster, and ikura - I think this was a special. It was a giant spoonful of heaven). The rolls had the perfect ratio of fish to rice, and the fish was fresh. 

Almost as importantly, the prices were completely reasonable, and the service was fast! So fast that I was skeptical - but I was wrong.

Can't wait to go back!
author: Jessica C.

description:
From the outside, Arashi doesn't look promising; it's not exactly on a "hoppin'" part of San Francisco's Richmond District. But your impressions may change once you're past the threshold.

Arashi looks spanking new, with sharp wooden tables and textured floors. The light is moody but never dark. There's Japanese pop music in the background - like ELT, but higher pitched. The inevitable flat-screen TV played silently in the background, subtitled in English.

The food is as good as I hoped. The obligatory miso soup (shiro miso) was sweet and flavorful, and it paired nicely with the genmaicha tea. Generous mounds of wasabi and sliced ginger.

1. Vegetable Tempura was a real surprise. Arashi avoids oily dishes; that arrived as a warm vegetable tempura wrapped in inari skin. Tasty and unexpected.

2. Nigiri. I tried eel and saba nigiri, and both were tender and tasty. The size was a little smaller than I hoped, given the price, but the flavor was on target.

3. Spider Roll was also well-seasoned, with not a hint of oiliness. The roll fell apart, during eating - not a problem for me.

I tried a Groupon discount, which made this meal a real bargain. Even without a discount, Arashi is a stylish family restaurant and a solid pick.
author: Thirsty C.

description: The sushi is alright but their customer service is near non-existent. I have eaten in the restaurant and the server we had was flippant at best. We have ordered delivery from here twice on two separate occasions with a 60-70 minute delivery window. Here we are at two hours and we still have no food. When I call to follow up, the phone rings until it disconnects.  Last time we waited 45 minutes past the later delivery time... this time we're an hour past and there is still no sign of food. Do yourself a favor and take your business elsewhere.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Great sushi, good portions, good prices.  Brought a group of five 6-yr-olds, and we all ate for around $60.  Not bad.
author: Kathy K.

description: I ordered Omakase and some other stuff. Omakase is a total rip off. Total amount of sushi you get is less than what you would get from individual orders, so you would end up paying more money for the same stuff?!? Nonsense!  I wasn't expecting to get more stuff but less? Come on people..
author: Jisun L.

description: Honestly was pleasantly surprised by the sushi! I had a Groupon and was expecting something more mediocre based on some of the reviews, but I would say the sushi was above average for me. I felt the fish was really fresh compared to other spots I've been to. I loved the hot lady roll and Romeo and Juliet roll, and I appreciated the tea for the cold weather. Generous portions of fish, and the flavors worked really well together. I also had the real crab roll which was a little more bland and would skip on that. I definitely plan to be back!
author: Chelsea T.

description:
My gal pals introduced me to some of the best sushi I've had in the city this past week and I can't srop thinking about it!


Arashi Sushi is a small spot on Geary Street, serving up an array of Japanese cuisine but our eyes were set on having a table full of sushi. And for a picky sushi eater like myself, it didn't disappoint. The service was absolutely wonderful, explaining everything without making me feel guilty for not knowing my sushi.


I ate so much sushi, I had to switch from chopsticks to a fork just to keep up! 


Do give yourself time to find parking, or better yet, hope the 38 MUNI bus and walk right into the door. Large groups better RSVP in advance and ask for the front bench area in the front corner if you're as loud as my gal pals and I!
author: Hala A.

description:
LOVE this place!!! Sushi chefs are friendly and the waitress is really great!!  She's super friendly and attentive. This has become our go to sushi spot since they almost always have really fresh fish. Happy hour is also a good deal, but we normally do dinner. It really is nice to go in after work and have friendly faces greeting you. 
It has a really chill atmosphere which is nice to wind down, also they have a tv in the back that normally plays baskletball/baseball games ;)
author: karol c.

description:
I am in search of a good Japanese restaurant.  Since we got a Groupon deal, we decided to try out this place on a weeknight.  We ordered a bunch of small plates and some drinks.

Food: Small plates were just okay.  We didn't order sushi much.  Sushi may have been better.

Service:  One of the servers was so loud and blunt, almost rude.  Not sure if she was just unhappy or upset with something.

Overall, 2.5 stars.  I could come back to try out their sushi but at this point, I will keep trying other Japanese restaurants.
author: M Y.

description:
I wish I can give them 5 stars, but there is couple things the need to work on.
edamame which they brought was old and cold, then we order couple rolls even though there was only two tables except  of us it took them like 30 minutes to bring our order.
Stuff is trying to do everything in same time , take your order, take phone calls , host new people and all it likely happens in the middle of our order.
Quality of food is average, oh and their wasabi is horrible .
Worst I ever had so far .
Really want to go back sometime next year !
author: Askhat E.

description: First time here on heart day and got a groupon which they vouched for. Everything was great and they were super nice. Little whole in the whole out of effin no where.... im coming back foe sho!!! Lol i need to try everything else. Had the hamachi carpaccio lil salty cuz the sauce but still yum. Had oysters and midnight oysters... yum!!!
author: Theresa M.

description: Came here on a Saturday around 3 PM and we were seated immediately. The restaurant was very clean and had nice decor. For the most part, I think everything was reasonably priced and we got almost all of our order within about 10 minutes of ordering. We had the house salad (HIGHLY recommend), miso soup, a Firecracker roll, a deep fried California roll, a Lion King roll, and a Hot Lady roll. Everything tasted great, and customer service was decent. Would definitely become a regular if we lived in town.
author: Ethan T.

description: This place is a little whole in the wall .. the cherry blossom was amazing, my son had the chicken ramen and we both agree we would come back again :)
author: Bonnie V.

description:
I liked this place a lot! Normally, i go to Sanraku, which is closer to my apartment in Nob Hill, but this place has equally fresh fish. The service is not as great as Sanraku, the teenage girl who waited on us seemed in a rush-- she didn't really care about what we wanted to order, or if we had any questions, and she didn't show up at our table until after we had sat for awhile (and after we had give our drink order to one of the other servers). We did have a question about what was in one of the rolls, which seemed to annoy her, and then she pretty much just ignored us as soon as we got our food. 

Food itself was pretty good! The sushi deluxe was about the same as Sanraku (~$30) but the sashimi pieces were MUCH larger. Delicious!
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
Bring your reading glasses. This places a massive list of sushi rolls. I felt like I was reading a book when I was looking through their menu.

Kudos to Groupon for helping me maintain my ballin on a budget status. My boyfriend and I came in and was initially bombarded with the amount of rolls they have. We decided to go with the giant roll and september 3rd. Plus, our added go-to orders of salmon sashimi, salmon belly nigiri, and tuna nigiri. Their fish quality is okay. The salmon sashimi was cut into 4 sad square pieces and the tuna had no taste. The giant roll was drenched in sauce and the whole sushi roll was essentially... lost in the sauce. The september 3rd roll was okay as well. Usually we get full off of 2 rolls, but these rolls were super small. I guess it a good thing because they weren't rolled with mounds of rice. 

Maybe we just tried the wrong things. My advice: Choose wisely.
author: Rachelle Y.

description: Love Arashi!! My favorite sushi  spot in the city. Fresh fish delivered daily!! Newly remodeled too
author: Sarah B.

description:
Copped a $30 Groupon for $15 and came here with my friend on a Wednesday night at 6:30pm. I called in for a reservation but the place was pretty much empty cept two tables and one bar individual. 

We sat for a bit and looked at the menu and at other Yelp reviews on some popular dishes. The waitress was really nice and brought us tea and gave us time to check out the menu as well. 

We finally decided on:

- SASHIMI OMAKASE: Great portion for two people. Consists of two pieces of 6 different fish and shrimp head. I'm allergic to crustaceans so I didn't try the amaebi and the shrimp heads but my friend said they were ok. I liked the hamachi the most. It was very fresh. The toro was fatty and stringy when I tried to bite it in half. What we both didn't like was the ankimo... VERY dry and pasty in my mouth... My friend and I took one bite and we looked at each other with the same wide-eyed, scrunched forehead, wtf expression. Def canned (3 stars) 

- SCALLOP NIGIRI: usually my favorite nigiri but it was just okay here. Topped with tobiko and green onions. (3 stars)

- Whole AJI fish: for $28 bucks I think, we got the AJI fish made in two different ways; sashimi and poke style. The sashimi slices were cut very thin which I liked and the fish was very fresh! Nicely done. The poke had a lot of flavor. They also included fresh wasabi (4 stars) 

For drinks we had a hot sake and two glass of white wine. In total with the $30 off from the groupon, we paid $40 each if I recall. Def buy the groupon tho! Overall, service was good and the waitress checked in on is regularly but food was just ok.
author: Anissa D.

description: Great food and nice environment. Amazing customer service would definitely recommend and come back
author: Anthony V.

description:
I had a Groupon deal that I bought which got me $30 worth of food. Absolutely worth the price for the Groupon deal! Decent pricing for Japanese cuisine even without purchasing the deal. No need to make a reservation or to tell them about the Groupon deal ahead of time. 

My friend and I ordered the chicken karage, beef skewers, dragon roll, and salmon shioyaki. Everything was flavorful and fresh! My favorite were the chicken karage and salmon. Both were perfectly tender and juicy. I greatly enjoyed that the chicken karage wasn't too heavy in batter and that they used dark meat. 

Service was pretty attentive. We parked a street away during prime dinner hour. Make sure to tip on the entire total if you are using a Groupon deal. I'd be back in a heartbeat when I crave Japanese cuisine!
author: Kristi T.

description: We ordered takeout and were unpleasantly surprised to find the Maguro Toro had gone rancid. It was completely inedible. We were so disappointed because the Sake Toro was delicious. We called to complain and did receive a refund.
author: Lindsey B.

description: I ordered for delivery and it showed up an hour late and cold! The food is so-so. Not worth it to be so late. Do not recommend
author: Ashley G.

description:
This is my 2nd review on Arashi.  We went to Arashi Sushi for dinner on 5/23/18 (Wed). It was delicious and passed my tests of fresh green tea, crispy tempura, and flavorful miso soup. On Wed, the food was so wonderful, we raved about it. The staff was attentive and cordial. We had Tempura Udon, Beef Teriyaki, and a Spider Roll. The tempura was very generous and crispy. The soup broth was delicious although just slightly salty. The quality of the beef for the teriyaki was very good and sliced nicely with a bowl of sauce in the middle of the plate instead of slathered all over the beef. The spider sushi was beautiful and delicious. The miso soup was red and white miso and perfect.

We decided to come back with a party of 6 for my birthday on 5/27/18 (Sun.).  When we arrived at 4:25 pm, the woman looked upset that we came without reservations. I told her that we were told on Wed night that we wouldn't need reservations if we came around that time. She said who told you that? I told her a man had. The restaurant wasn't full and we were seated. So, I don't know what her problem was.  Interesting thing was my boyfriend & I decided to order the same items.  "When the food came, it was INCONSISTENT WITH PRESENTATION AND TASTE." The beef teriyaki came with too much sauce poured all over it instead of a bowl of sauce in the middle of the plate. The chicken teriyaki also came with too much sauce poured on and swimming in it. The soup for the udon noodles was tasteless and almost like just water with a little bit of soy sauce in it.   The spider sushi was a lot smaller!  The miso soup shocked me as it was only white miso and less robust because there was no red miso in it.   

Wait staff was rough and she even addressed as "Hey guys." and the rest of the conversation was similar. She poured the tea so fast that I was afraid that it was going to fly out of the cups and spill on us. 

One last thing that 3 people at our table complained about and found difficult to deal with was the very strong perfume smell in the area we were sitting.  It made one get a headache and another a sore throat. It may have been permeating from the restrooms. 

All in all, our 2nd visit to Arashi on the weekend was a huge disappointment. The food and customer service is inconsistent and there doesn't appear to be a standard for either.
author: Cynthia H.

description:
Did Arashi take us by storm? 
As one of the newer sushi restaurants in the neighborhood, we were curious to give it a try. The restaurant had the typical sushi bar and also a separate dining room separated by a curtain.
We ordered...

Chirashi - with tuna, salmon, salmon roe, shrimp tail, tamago, etc. over rice:
Most of the fish tasted pretty fresh and sweet, but the tamago wasn't very sweet. The serving seemed to be on the small side too.

Fish Tacos - 2 Pcs w/ Albacore, salmon, avocado, salsa on fried nori:
Most variations come on a fried tortilla chip or wonton crisp, so fried nori was an interesting rendition. It was crunchy and somewhat puffed up. It came together nicely with creamy avocado, strips of fish, and tart salsa.

Cha-Shu Ramen - cha-shu, fish cake, mushroom, bamboo shoots, egg, bean sprouts, corn, green onion, fried garlic, dry seaweed:
Mr. Joy was curious to try the ramen, but as usual, I'm skeptical of ramen from restaurants that do not specialize in ramen. The broth was a little bland. The pork was rather dry and the egg was slightly overcooked. The noodles and various toppings like corn and seaweed strips were okay though. 

Perhaps it is best to stick to the sushi and the rolls. The fish tacos were the most enjoyable of the bunch. I'd give Arashi another try if I were in the neighborhood with a sushi craving.
author: Joy W.

description:
One of the beautiful things about San Francisco is the amazing variety of sushi.  So even though I have clear favorites, I'm always down to try something new.  Today that was Arashi Sushi.

Though it is slightly more expensive than Wild Sushi (my benchmark for price/quality), the fish was divine.  And they had shiro maguro toro sashimi!  Seriously, you should get some of that.

Looks like my rotation just got a new entry, between Wild and Kabuto...
author: Joey Y.

description: The beef tongue is soooooo good!!!  It's very juicy and I really like the BBQ taste!!  Also, their tea rice is very special!! You put tea into the rice with wasabi!!  I have never though of eating rice this way!!  It's really good!!!  I'll definitely come back again!!!
author: Winnie W.

description: This is my favorite Japanese restaurant in the Bay Area. I really like the decoration after they remodeled. We ordered special Sashimi, Sushi rolls, and some BBQs. I am so surprised that the sashimi was sooo fresh! The waitress told me that the fish was from JP  For BBQ, I really like the beef, shrimp and pork sausages. They are very juicy and yummy! Must try! Highly recommend this place !
author: Jasmine S.

description:
Came across this place during a hangry adventure after the gym, and it was a very pleasant experience. Service was good - food came out fast and the waitress was super attentive. Granted the restaurant wasn't full when we came (er, we were the only ones there since they were closing soon) but I'm always super appreciative of great customer service. 

Food was so good! We had the chicken kaarage, Halloween roll, unagi don, and the chicken katsu dinner plate. Lots of food - all very good! First time I've ordered an unagi don...and it didn't disappoint! Would definitely come back!
author: Nicole B.

description: The sashimi is awesome in taste especially after dipping the fresh wasabi. IT's incredibly delicious. The beef tongue skewers are so dope. Juicy and Tasty!! I'm sure I will go back in the coming future.
author: Ares Y.

description:
The hunt for the go-to neighborhood sushi joint continues.. this time we gave Arashi a try.

First things first, right after the waitress gave us the menus, she told us they were out of salmon that day. I know Sundays aren't great days to get sushi, but how do you run out of salmon when you are an average sushi restaurant?! Was the salmon in the back not defrosting fast enough? Mind blown. Anyway, we had a Groupon and were pretty hungry so we decided to stay.   

+ Chirashi - decently sized portions. The albacore was definitely the highlight of this dish as it was extremely fatty and melted in my mouth, definitely a pleasant surprise. Everything else was pretty average, though.

Sidenote: I'm usually cautious of restaurants that serve 'white tuna,' since it could be walu/escolar (which may cause digestive problems), so I opted for no white tuna. I later found out that they have walu/escolar on their menu, so I should have said no escolar instead -___-. I'm pretty sure it was included in the chirashi, but when we asked what a particular opaque white cut of fish was, our server said 'butterfish' aka escolar, upon Googling what a 'butterfish' was. We didn't end up getting the shits that night cause we each only ate one piece so I guess we dodged that bullet.. although I think you have to eat a lot of it to actually experience some discomfort.

+ Hamachi toro nigiri - decided to order this because it seemed interesting, but the texture wasn't as buttery as I imagined. Never had this anywhere, so maybe it's supposed to be like this.

+ X and Spider rolls - haven't ordered rolls in dayssss, but once in a while I don't mind some carbs, fish covered in sauce and whatever else they pile and stuff into those things lol. We asked the waiter what they would substitute the salmon with in the rolls, and he replied that they actually do have salmon but just enough for rolls. I'm guessing they only had scraps left which could be thrown on the rolls. Size of the rolls were a bit small for the price.

Overall, not terrible but I'd probably want to try other spots around the area before coming back here again.
author: Laverne N.

description: I love food, but I love discounted food even more. So of course, I get super excited when I'm on Groupon and come across a restaurant that has four stars on yelp! Purchased the Groupon and came here with my boyfriend on date night. Our server was super friendly and kindly charged my phone for me using their charger (I needed my phone alive so I could redeem the Groupon). The food was great! We ordered three rolls: the foxy, the crunchy monkey, and the volcano. The crunchy monkey was interesting because it was wrapped in soy paper rather than seaweed. Visually, the one that stood out was the volcano roll. It was lit! Literally.
author: Lexi R.

description:
Ordered through Eat24. The sushi arrived on time. The tempura roll was still hot, and everything else tasted as hoped. 

The pricing was great for the amount we received. We also got a free dynamite roll for spending 35. 

Overall, would absolutely order takeout again. I'm sure going in would also be better.
author: Carmen C.

description:
My mind is kind of blown that this place has four stars, where more legit sushi places (especially in San Mateo which is a sushi hot spot) have the same rating. The four stars here is a bit deceptive to me, and not all four star places are created equal! We came here because we saw a Groupon for this place but we actually intended to go to Ariake Sushi and I mistakenly read the name of the restaurant the Groupon was for (which is nearby and better if you're searching for a sushi spot in this area). We came here on a Friday, and it was very easy to get a seat. Also, I will say one thing about this place: the service is very good and the servers are all very friendly. 

Sushi places are broken up into different types for me. You have your super high end sushi spot, where I often opt for the omakase menu for about $100 and only go for a special occasion. Then you have your middle of the road quality sushi places, where I judge them by the following: (1) quality of sushi; and (2) price. This is like the weekly Friday date night type of sushi restaurant. And then you have your all you can eat sushi restaurants, where a whole different set of criteria apply. I would classify this place as a middle of the road sushi place. So how does it rate? 

(1) Quality of Sushi: The quality was not bad. I would say it's on par with other middle of the road sushi places I've been to. The rolls are decent, though a bit small which I talk about below. Their uni is a little weird, because it was cut up into a lot of little pieces when they served it to us. As a result, it looked a little unappetizing. 

(2) Price of Sushi: I was not a fan of the size of our rolls. As a point of comparison, other places, like Fuji Sukiyaki or Joy Sushi in San Mateo, have much bigger rolls for the price. I think we ordered three rolls. Normally, this would fill us up at those two places in San Mateo. However, I was still hungry afterward. Even with the Groupon discount, this dinner ran us about $70 which is fine for a middle of the road quality sushi place but not justified by the food we got.

Ultimately, knowing that I could get heftier, good quality rolls at the same price made me feel like I wouldn't come back to this place. I think like Jared says in Silicon Valley, this place needs to pivot if it's going to stay in business and to get people to come back.
author: Lin Z.

description:
Went here for dinner on a weeknight.  The restaurant itself is unimpressive but the first thing I noticed was a large row of delivery and pick-up orders being processed which told me the food would be good.  

We ordered tonkatsu, tempura, veggie roll, and a crunchy California roll.  The crunchy California roll was a slam dunk as it was a nice variation on the traditional and sometimes boring California roll. The tonkatsu was decent and had a huge portion of meat with rice and salad that left me happily full. 

Staff was very nice and gracious.  Would def go here again for Japanese food.
author: Dan O.

description:
Hella good! Came here last night after a foot massage(next door). Ten minutes after arrival, the whole place packed up. Many servers, two sashimi chefs. Service and food is straight to the point. Four plus a baby and he was making loud noises. Yet, the servers were still friendly. 

Food: 2 orders omakase sushi. 2 sashimi deluxe platters. Uni/oysters shooters. Grilled hamachi. Baby lobster. Gyoza. They were out of ankimo and gave us the hamachi salad for free. Very pretty presentations. 68 bucks per head. Not bad for that much super fresh seafood.
author: Vee V.

description: Today, my friends and i went to Akashi Sushi...the server had a great smile and excellent service. I will go back next time. Ambience is very relaxing. I will come back next time......
author: Carlo S.

description: Made a late stop as I was too starved to last the ride to Tracy. Even though they had all the fish put away they were happy to serve me. Best serving of Ankimo I have ever tasted and each of the other items were quite excellent also. Don't get into the City often but this will be a go-to stop.
author: Derrol H.

description:
On a week night, it's not crowded, it has TV that plays sports, wide range of sushi selection, expedited services, free edamame, lightly salted. Very reasonable prices for sake and beer, which he promptly ordered upon sitting down. I attributed it to him being of a certain type of men, the type who apparently thinks that it's a good idea to chase a cold beer down with a shot of hot sake, I am not into that combo, but I would take a small sip of hot sake from time to time.

I'm beginning to appreciate portion appropriate sushi. You see, sushi should be a one bite food, you pick up with your hands or chopsticks, you gracefully put it in your mouth, close your mouth and then chew. That's the gauge I'd have for a good portion, too small it feels that you've been cheated, too large it feels that you are committing gluttony, you don't need to be religious to feel overindulgent.  

I find Arashi has good portion control. In addition, its white tuna was quite delicious. It makes a distinction between hamachi and hamachi belly, that's interesting enough for me to order the belly just to see if I could tell the difference, sadly I couldn't but I suspect belly meat generally is fattier, and to some, fishier. Like when you get your lutefisk fix in Norway after mid October. They often serve two portions, the regular piece of meat, and then onto the "back of the fish", as the Norwegians would call it. It's fishier, and therefore, to some, yummier. I liked the belly a lot. We did another order of it.

There are many advantages to eating here, perhaps the unexpected one is that it's a fairly inexpensive expedition, if you sticks to their nigiri selections.
author: Victoria E.

description:
I've ordered from here before and they NEVER seem to fail! The food is delicious! The price is good! the delivery is quick and easy! I just got my delivery and I couldn't be more happy with my order. I've gotten delivery from other sushi spots and they sometimes forget condiments (or barley add any), or forget something from my order. BUT NOT THIS PLACE :)
recommend, recommend, recommend!
author: Mireya H.

description: The taco sushi is BOMB. Highly recommend to anyone. Great price, delicious food and even better service.
author: Jacky R.

description: Ordered takeaway - which was actually decent food, but ordered through Grubhub and it took almost an HOUR longer than originally guaranteed.  Will not order again.
author: Sarah Louise H.

description: 5 staring for the service! And the fish! Joey, our server, was absolutely amazing! Valentine's Day and the place was slammed with couples. She killed it. The sushi was melt in your mouth and delicious
author: Patrick H.

description: What freaking horrible place to order for delivery. I have them so many chances and they mess it up everything. Always more than hour to get any food.  Today has been the worst!!! Ordered my food at 514pm and delivery time say 60-70mins. I checked the status at 620pm and it said the food will leave the restaurant soon.  At 640pm I called and they said they can't find my order. Then the manager said oh the driver will come back and pick up your order.  No apologies and nothing. So I waited for 1.5hrs and the driver is out without my food. They can't tell me when I'll be able to get my food. Isn't that nice?  I guess this is normal way of doing business.  I gave this place more chances than they deserve.  I soooo want to say out some bad words in here.
author: Jaime L.

description: Got it delivered. I was not impressed either by the quantity, the quality and the fact it arrived cold. Also last health inspection scores were 86, 83, 83 for the last three years. Not impressed.
author: Matthew C.

description:
Got this as a Groupon deal and wanted to check it out. Unfortunately, we tried the restaurant twice and found both times to be unsatisfying.

The fish didn't taste super fresh and some of the food was quite bland. The baked mussels were ok and had some good flavor, the vegetable ramen was tasteless, some of the sushi rolls we tried were basic and uninteresting. I wouldn't recommend this spot.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I have to admit that, before coming to Arashi, they hardly made a blip on my Yelp radar.  Not that I didn't think they'd be worth trying; there just wasn't anything to prioritize them over any of the other Japanese restaurants that the Richmond has to offer.  At least, until my buddy offered to split his Amazon Local deal with me.  Woohoo for eating on the cheap!

Taking over the spot where Rockin' Crawfish used to be, it's hard to imagine this is the same space (Arashi is much more open and brighter).  As for the menu, it's pretty typical for the most part (starters, sashimi, a lot of rolls, udon/ramen, and dinner entrees over bento boxes), except with the addition of robata grill and house specialty items.

**NOTE: Prices are off the menu, but our portions may have been different because of our Amazon Local deal - the starters mentioned below plus 2 Miso Soup's ($1.95 each), Garlic Edamame ($4.95), and any two sushi rolls (the soup and edamame were pretty standard).

-- AGEDASHI TOFU - Fried Tofu with Bonito Flakes and Tempura Sauce...$4.50
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arashi-sushi-house-san-francisco?select=tCMSi8YaKXhsr9tu3e5k0w)
Maybe it's because I haven't had this in a while, but the dish was pretty good.  Although the skin was a little gummy, the tofu was pretty big and silky smooth.  The sauce was nice as well, though bonito flakes would have been much better than the shavings we got.

-- MIXED TEMPURA (6 Pcs)...$5.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arashi-sushi-house-san-francisco?select=uvQ6_BsnwDiw31t8zp9VOQ)
I've had some bad luck with tempura dishes lately, but this one was surprisingly decent.  Not only was the batter mostly crispy, but it didn't have that "fried in old oil" look/taste to it.  Plus, the veggies and shrimp weren't torched, which can't be said for others I've had recently...

-- PLUM SAKE SASHIMI...Unlisted (though we estimated about $10.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arashi-sushi-house-san-francisco?select=v7z1YrjZ0mm0n9dE-sNKXw)
It's a shame this isn't on the regular menu, as it was the best dish of the night.  There was a slight tartness from the plum sauce, but I thought the taste of the dish as a whole was good.  The cuts of salmon were relatively fresh and I liked the slight kick of the jalapeno.

-- X ROLL - Hamachi & Avocado topped with Salmon, Tuna, Tobiko, and Spicy Mayo...$10.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arashi-sushi-house-san-francisco?select=RULzPzTYWTaBO8-Ax4X9jg)
Similar to a Rainbow Roll, but better (no shrimp or crab salad).  That being said, I'd be hard pressed to say this was exceptional.  All three cuts seemed fresh enough, but as much as I like all three types individually, the overall taste didn't come together like I would have hoped.

-- BAY SCALLOP - Spicy Tuna topped with Seared Scallop, Green Onions, and Spicy Mayo...$11.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arashi-sushi-house-san-francisco?select=dBdvDQNHZG_fII6UD-sqHw)
I generally like rolls with (bay) scallops, but this one missed the mark.  While the spicy tuna wasn't bad (not a big fan in general), the scallops were rather "meh".  Rather than adding a nice crust/texture, the sear served more to numb the natural flavor/sweetness of the scallop.

-- CRUNCHY LOBSTER - Lobster Salad and Cucumber topped with Salmon, Avocado, Crunchy Flake, Tobiko, Green Onion, and Special Sauce...$12.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arashi-sushi-house-san-francisco?select=zE6ayzjJ58szdg65g_gs2w)
A typical "jive ass roll", though different than what I had imagined.  High school Mike might have liked the mayo, sauce, and "flakes", but current Mike thought they only overwhelmed the lobster and salmon, which should be featured instead of (literally) buried.  Skip.

In the case of most sushi joints, I usually find that the hot/cooked dishes end up holding back the rest of the food.  However, in this case, the rolls (ha!) were reversed.  For that reason, and the fact that most people probably come here for the sushi, I'm rounding down from THREE AND A HALF STARS.  Although, that's not to say Arashi can't be better; from what I've seen on Yelp, there's some potential with their sashimi and specialty dishes!
author: Mike L.

description:
One of the best happy hour deals in San Francisco.  Pretty much half price for a variety of Japanese foods.  The sushi chefs are pretty creative too, from what I have seen.

I swing by here on my way back to Marin once a week between 4:30 and 6pm.  Less than 10 minutes from the Golden Gate Bridge right on my way home.
author: Joe S.

description:
I came here with a friend using the Groupon special. usually, I hate using Groupons on food since a few of the Groupons that I used for restaurants, they were not good. However, this is an exception!

The waygu roll is a must try. It's quite strange since the flavor is so confusing, but in a good way! My tastebuds were going crazy! The first piece I tried tasted like hot pot. After a few seconds after I chewed a little more into it, it was like tataki because of the ponzu sauce. Finally, as I was about to swallow it, the avacado taste was finally existing. It' liek changing 3 flavors at once!

All the other rolls I tried were pretty decent for the price I paid for. I will definitely come back!
author: Allie Y.

description: My favorite sushi place in town! I love raw fish and their X and Warriors roll have a lot of raw fish. Their beef and chicken teriyaki are always excellent. The meat is very juicy and tender. There's also a sunset roll which is a cucumber wrap sushi-no rice. Delicious. Ive also had hamachi and sake kama. Both are very good. I definitely recommend this place for Japanese.
author: Christina L.

description:
Don't order delivery from these guys. We ordered through Yelp Eat24 at 8:15pm and expected he food on 45min-1 hour as stated in website. At the one hour mark, we messaged Eat24, they stated the driver was on the way-ETA is 10-15 minutes. Mind you, this restaurant is a 17 minute  drive from us. Half an hour later, still no food
So we message Eat24 again-told the same thing-food is 10-15min away. It's 9:52 at this point and we requested cancellation of order.  Can't imagine they're that busy. This is extremely poor customer service as well as dishonest.
author: Maria T.

description:
I was craving sushi. Finally decided to try Arashi and ordered delivery on Monday, May 11th around 6pm thru Eat24. Delivery took the average amount of time, about an hour, and was packaged well.

*Midnight oyster (2 pcs): oyster, uni, ikura, quail egg, scallions, ponzu ($7.95)
Beautiful and delicious. I love the combination of oyster, uni and quail egg. I did wish the oysters had more of a sweet briny flavor to them, but this was still a very enjoyable dish. It was hard to take everything in one bite due to all the different components, but I didn't care since I loved the flavors.

*Butterfish carpaccio: butter fish, jalapeno, sweet onion, ikura, ponzu sauce
This was okay. The ponzu sauce was a little too much when I poured the whole container onto the dish. I wished this had a little more heat to counteract the fattiness and citrus flavors.

*Sake toro nigiri: salmon belly ($4.95)
*Hamachi toro nigiri: yellowtail belly ($5.50)
*Ankimo nigiri: monkfish liver ($4.50)
*Uni nigiri: sea urchin ($9.50) +Quail egg (+$1)

All the nigiri was pretty good. I enjoyed the yellowtail and salmon belly the most. The ankimo and uni were okay. I wanted the ankimo to have a creamier rich flavor and the uni didn't quite have that sweet ocean taste.

One of the main reasons I decided to order from Arashi was because they offered a Clam soup. Unfortunately, I guess this item is no longer on the menu? A little disappointing since I really wanted some soup. Tried to replace it with the chashu ramen, but I guess it was too late.

Very average delivery experience. Probably not my favorite place to order sushi, but I like that they deliver their midnight oysters. That may be the only reason I'll order from them again.
author: Elena N.

description:
If you're hungry, this may not be the place for you.

After several rolls and several appetizers, we're still hungry. But given the quality of the sushi here, we'd rather walk around Geary and pick up more food somewhere else.

Came here because my friend had to try this place, but we should have known that it was a bit dodgy being that we're the only ones here on a Wednesday night at 6pm.

The garlic edamame was okay. The fried tofu was awful and plain. The mixed tempura was small, and didn't have the sweet potato that I usually like, or the fried carrot.

The miso soup was watery.

The gyoza was too deep fried. Did they forget about it in the fryer?

The spider roll was super small and on the cold side. I would prefer the soft-shell crab to be hot. 

Extra charge of $1 for real crab meat, that just tasted like fake crab mixed with mayonnaise.

The sake sashimi platter tasted a bit stale, and I really didn't like the plum sauce or the bitter lemon.

The shrimp tempura roll was also on the cold side.

Really not worth the $60 plus bill.

I could have had some fine quality prime rib at the House of Prime Rib, sides, and a salad for that price.

For reals!

The service was okay, they were pretty good on refilling the tea and clearing plates, though in-between they seem to be chatting with each other pretty loudly.

At least one of us is having a good time.

Because it sure isn't me.
author: Jack R.

description: Arashi is my go to sushi place in the city. The sushi is always so fresh and delicious.
author: Sofia B. C.

description: Delivery through Eat24 is so so so so bad. Delivery in general is bad. Every time I order from Arashi my food arrives ICE cold. Not even warm. I thought it was a fluke and so I would still order from them but no. This time, I decided to order mostly cold dishes. So at least I know my food will arrive at the temperature expected. Except, of course, the Gyoza. My order is now over 30 minutes late, I already tipped the driver on a $45 order through the app. I am super annoyed and really hungry. This is ridiculous. I would suggest that the restaurant train their delivery staff to use delivery apps properly and to PLEASE update the customer through the app if you are delayed. I'm done with Arashi delivery. Pretty sure I just gave someone a tip for delivering food 30 minutes late. So total from order to delivery 1 hour 20 minutes.
author: Patricia E.

description:
I forgot to review this place last week while I was in town. I ended up eating here after the restaurant my friend and I were gonna eat at closed early for some reason. 
This was an excellent choice! 
First of all, cheap, delicious sushi in SF is about as difficult to find as a smart Trump supporter. So hallelujah to that!
Second, our food was done super quick and was literally some of the best Japanese fare I've had in my life. The waitress was very attentive despite being the only one working at the time (I know the feels, girl) and I left her a generous tip because I really appreciated her accuracy and composure doing her job. Waitressing was the worst job I ever had, so someone like her deserves good tips. 
I definitely plan to return when I'm back in the area, and I'll even spend five whole minutes trying to parallel park just to do so. 
Great meal.
author: Kaylee H.

description: Sushi was small rolls compared to Kyoto restaurant for the $$. But it was good. Waitress didn't have any customers service skills, she acted like she hates her job, n provide poor service.
author: Ms R.

description:
TL;DR The sushi is average but slightly expensive. We were forgotten and forced to wait 40 minutes for our food without any acknowledgement or apology. 

If it wasn't for the Groupon deal, I wouldn't have come here. Arashi serves average, somewhat pricey sushi compared to other local sushi restaurants and is definitely not a bad place, but nothing particularly special. My boyfriend and I have eaten here twice now and have minimal complaints about our first visit; however, our second visit was sadly very disappointing. We waited a whopping 40 minutes for our order of three rolls. The waitress and/or chefs must have forgotten to prepare our food, since the table next to us ordered at the same time but already finished and paid before we even got our first roll. The waitress never even checked in on us or apologized for the absurdly long wait. We ordered the Rainbow roll, 49er roll, and the Lion King. To us, the 49er roll was a bit plain and the Lion King was too saucy. The reason why I'm giving this place three stars instead of two is because the waiter who started his shift and served us towards the end of our meal was friendly and nice.
author: Jacqueline L.

description:
A good array of unique rolls! Anything that has butterfish is soooo good. 
Love:
Romeo and Juliet roll
Giants roll
Sake Kama (worth the wait)
Hamachi carpaccio

The Kobe no rice roll was meh but everything else I've had is bomb.

Reasonable prices also - its in a lot of delivery apps too which is convenient. If you eat in be sure to finish your food or they'll give you a hard time
author: Sarah P.

description: Chicken Katsu like no other! Best ever! Great service as well! No lines, no waiting, nothing but the best! Come to this place and eat!
author: Gerald P.

description:
Whenever I go for sushi, quantity is just as important as quality and this place definitely does a good job with both for the price-point. They've also got a great selection of rolls and all the raw fish we had was really fresh!

We ordered:
Age Dashi Tofu: This was super flavorful
5 PC sushi set: These 5 pieces of sashimi were soooooooo good. Definitely had the melt in your mouth feel when you eat good quality fish. 
Tuna Lover Roll: Tuna topped with seared tuna, this was probably our favorite roll. The fish was so fresh it melted in my mouth. Definitely recommend!
Sakura Roll: Unagi and avocado topped with salmon and ikura (big orange fish eggs). Presentation was great and the salmon on top was so good I just ate it separately from the rest of the roll haha.
X Roll: Hamachi, avocado, topped with salmon, tuna and spicy mayo; I loved the fish in this roll but the spicy mayo was a little much. It tasted a lot better without

Like many people, came here with a groupon, which definitely saved us a bit of money. For everything above, after applying the groupon, was around $30, and we were both so stuffed afterwards. Definitely a solid sushi experience, mostly because the Groupon helped soften the blow to our wallets. Happy eating!
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
Enjoy watching T.V while u eat your food! Sounds like a great deal to me!

I came here on a Groupon Deal on December 28th and our Groupon deal was: $26 for $53 worth of food. 

I came here on a date and was quite surprised that we got seated so quickly. Once you walk in their are a couple tables on the right and in the back they have more of a private setting with 3 tables. I decided to be seated in the back so we can have some privacy.

We sat down and immediately after we were given a menu. We were told that the menu was the Groupon deal and it was already made out for us. This is what we got:
$26 for a sushi dinner for two (up to $53 value)

    2 miso soups
    Bowl of garlic edamame
    4 pieces of hiyashi tofu
    4 pieces of mix tempura
    6 pieces of plum sake sashimi
    One roll of choice per person

Everything was good. I don't like Tofu so I didn't eat it neither did my date. But we tried the Sashimi and OMG!! Its a must try! You have to eat it all in one bite for you to really get the full experience of how good it is!

The garlic Edamame were amazing and the best I have tried. Once you eat one trust me your hand will be reaching for more!

I felt that the food was just enough for both of us and we walked out pretty pleased and full!

The server and workers here were really nice and as we both are water lovers the server we had made sure that our glasses were fully stocked (at all times)

I would definitely go back again and I wouldn't mind ordering the Groupon Deal again as well.
author: Porsche C.

description: The sushi rolls are good. The only complaint is how thin the fish slices are on the nigiri-you get a lot of rice with really thin fish slices on top.
author: Secira N.

description:
I really love the sushi here and it's my go to for take out.

Some of my favorites include the hamachi & salmon nigiri, salmon avocado roll, X roll, spicy scallop roll, and baked mussels. They usually deliver in less than the time estimated and the food is always fresh!
author: Stephanie T.

description: This placed failed my test.  Would not take Groupon order to go; eat in only and because I was buying dinner for family I was served a lot of food which I had to repack after being told I had to eat part of it to use Groupon.  Server curt, non-smiling and not friendly...which only incensed me more.  Who knows why people would come here in the first place.  Food was average.
author: Padme J.

description:
1 star because I used to like coming here and grabbing sashimi but my last experience was just TERRIBLE. 

Came in during happy hour and ordered tried some off the stuff from their menu. The spicy tuna roll was $6 I believe and was the most basic cheap roll I've ever had. I could've made it myself at home. 

Also we also tried their $1 oysters and soon as I tasted it I felt like throwing up. The oysters were BAD!!!!! When I told the waitress to take the oysters away from or table she came back and told us that she would take the 6 oysters off our bill because she ADMITTED THAT THEY WERE SPOILED. She didn't even bother to offer us at least a complimentary ice cream scoop or anything, we weren't expecting it but it's the LEAST she could've done after serving us spoiled oysters. Ugh the oyster was SO FRIGGIN DISGUSTING. 

I used to like this place but the past few times the service and quality has just completely gone down. Their sashimi isn't as fresh as it used to be. After that oyster incident I don't plan on returning.
author: Amanda R.

description:
Bye Bye Rockin' Crawfish
Hi Arashi Sushi House

Arashi Sushi House took over the location of where Rockin' Crawfish use to be. Like many sushi restaurants in the Richmond district, this is another addition to the neighborhood.

Arashi has an extensive menu. Lunch specials. Cold and hot appetizers. Salad. Sushi rolls. Entrees and even ramen! Dessert and sake. Happy Hour - Monday thru Friday 5pm-8pm.

Hamachi Kama (yellowtail collar) was delicious and perfectly cooked. The sashimi was simply fresh. The rice on the sushi rolls were a bit too soft and soggy. 

The Whole Fish Sashimi (Black Sea Bream) was the best of it all! The fish was cut thinly and beautifully presented and plated. The fish not only looked picture worthy, but tasted fresh too! It came with fresh wasabi and 3 dipping sauces. I didn't know that fresh wasabi didn't taste as spicy as regular wasabi. 

The service was superb! Our waters and tea was refilled constantly. Since we ordered a lot of dishes, they were nice enough to move the small table next to us to combine it into one long table so we would have more space. 

I'll be back to try the other items on their menu!
author: Kathleen U.

description:
I wish I could give this a good review but I can't!  
Ordered vegetable tempura, and they didn't even deliver the dipping sauce (who does that?) they gave me about 5 small veggies that were deep fried, and one of them was a jalapeno.  Who deep fries jalapeno????
not to mention the rolls were packed loosely and seaweed was chewy.  

:( So sad!

Update:
Their inari and tamago smelled and tasted SPOILED!!
Inari is supposed to be sweet and it was sour.  
My dog smelled it and didn't even try to eat it.
I'm so disgusted.
author: Sonya A.

description:
Sorry must have had high expectations coming in. Was not impressed at all. I miss Rockin' Crawfish which once occupied the same space. 

Skip the ramen! Lots of noodles but doesn't taste good. Broth is lacking. 
Some of the rolls were ok. Again nothing special. DON'T do the monk fish liver. No flavor. And very weird looking. I eat just about anything under the sun so if I think it's weird...
author: Stephen Y.

description:
Decided to give this place a try since there was a Groupon deal...

My bf and I each ordered the 8 pc Omakase, which is what we usually order at good looking sushi restaurants. I told the waitress that I liked salmon but when our Omakase arrived, I didn't get any salmon pieces.

We were both very disappointed because the pieces were all very stiff in texture and some of the fish were gamey/briny. None of the pieces melted in our mouths and I couldn't even swallow some of the pieces because they were just too gamey...
We also had a piece of fish that was salty with blood in it....uhhh... is that even edible? yuck face. yuck face. 

Bleh.... I'm still giving the yuck face thinking about it...
author: Leilani Y.

description: The service was great. The lady that was serving us was very nice and she was really keeping us happy. You could tell that they wanted you to get the most out of your meal and money. The sashimi was very fresh. The tempera was warm and overall, the food was great. The server was always making sure we were happy with our food. I had a great experience with my family. We all really enjoyed the food and service.
author: Kaitlyn C.

description:
Found out about Arashi Sushi on Yelp and wanted to give it a shot. I should start by saying "Great staff and great service!". I am not a sushi expert, and they took their time to explain and give suggestions.

On the other hand, amazing sushi! Temptation is my favorite! Definitely would come back again.
author: Ugur O.

description:
Battery died 2 photos in. #smh #firstphoneproblems
So I got all pre-Internet and drew my food.

Walu (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arashi-sushi-house-san-francisco?select=MXG_MaRJ69xP-7_bij83Pg)
Uni (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arashi-sushi-house-san-francisco?select=MXG_MaRJ69xP-7_bij83Pg)
Cucumber Summer Madness Roll (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arashi-sushi-house-san-francisco?select=uAC0KvCtJxYJH5MvZe6kfw)
Wagyu Roll (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arashi-sushi-house-san-francisco?select=uAC0KvCtJxYJH5MvZe6kfw)
Menu (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arashi-sushi-house-san-francisco?select=mP0uApPmKRRkFcUnHsuuDw)

Resto has "everything" Japanese,
Plus some custom in-house items.
Cool set-your-own-price omakase.

Dude all-black outfit x navy shoes?
#datfashionfauxpasdoe #justsayin
author: Dan B.

description: The food itself was OK. But our waitress didn't speak English, she didn't understand what we were saying and simply said yes to every question we asked. My dish still didn't come after waiting for 39 mins, we asked her about it and she just said yes over and over again. Eventually we asked another waiter and finally got our food, but my friend's dish was already cold by the time my dish finally arrived(it took almost an hour)
author: Wenqian G.

description:
If you want mediocre, chewy sushi, order from them. 

If you want to be treated like shit by a delivery driver, order from them! 

Let me explain....

I received a phone call not asking me to come down to pick up my delivery but demanded me to when he could push my buzzer like every single other person does! The rudest delivery driver ever!  He shoved the bag in my hand and said your food! What the fuck?! 

The food: I ordered two items which were fried.  Both were so soggy and wet, we ate half and threw it away. Such a waste.  

The portion of their veggie/shrimp tempura was the smallest amount I've ever been given for the price!  Ridiculous. 

I have not been into this restaurant physically but if that's how they treat their customers, period, I'm never going in there!
author: Maddy B.

description:
Bought the $30 groupon and felt like we received $1 service. We were seated immediately and given menus + water. However we sat at the table for 30min+, waiting for the 1 and only server to take our order. Honestly, if you have 1 server, don't bite off more than you can chew. 

I'm not sure whether to blame management, or the 1 server who was working his butt off, trying to take care of 8+ tables and bussing them himself. Maybe it's no wonder that this place is getting to desperate point of offering a groupon, to try to increase their business.

Fingers crossed, hoping for a free dessert after this bad experience.

What's worse, is that I already bought 2 of these groupons from this place
author: Ryan L.

description: I don't know how or why they got 4 stars... don't order from here. Especially delivery. Gross. I don't understand how they could send me food with that low of quality.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Great food, nice environment and really nice service. They gave some really good recommendations that were delicious!! 10/10 RECOMMEND
author: Fiona H.

description: Some people really love this place but I thought it was mediocre at best. I got the chirashi, which comes with miso soup (which was pretty good) and free edamame. The fish was decently fresh, but the chirashi only comes with tuna, white tuna, salmon, hamachi, shrimp, and tamago. So nothing to write home about.
author: Sherry L.

description: I really like their music in there, easy to sing along.  Everything is really fresh, especially the appetizers.  I posted the pics.  The cucumber sushi was refreshing.  Thecgrilled salmon kama was fresh. You just want to see this restaurant survive, since there has been five restaurant turnoves in the very spot..  It is a good solid restaurant.  If you check-in, you get free sake,  who doesn't want free sake.  I wouldn't say you will be stuffed after your meal, but you have to save room for dessert in the neighborhood.  Service was very attentive.  You can actually have a conversation in there.
author: Helen L.

description: They really need a new delivery person. Delivery came a full hour late. We had ordered both hot items and cold items, and the delivery driver stacked the items so that the cold items were on top of the hot items. When our order FINALLY arrived, the driver called me rather than use the apartment buzzer then yelled in the phone for me to come get my food. He then shoved it in my hands as I was opening the door and walked off. So now I've got both room temperature sushi, and room temperature beef. Definitely room for improvement.
author: Patrick Y.

description:
To be honest, the reason I ate at Arashi Sushi House because I got a groupon deal $30 credit for $15. After I checked the restaurant rating on Yelp,I decided to give it a try. 

We got to the restaurant around 6:30pm and we got seated immediately. The restaurant was clean and big. I think this restaurant used to be old Crawstation restaurant. We ordered Sake Toro nigiri, Hamachi Toro nigiri, tuna nigiri, Omakase sushi  ( 8 pcs) and Omaskase sashimi.

Overall, the presentation for the omaskase sashimi was the only one that I'm impressed about. The quality of the sushi was average nothing impressive, but they really need to work on their knife skill and skill on making sushi. For example,  the tuna nigiri we got, it looked like they just placed the tuna on top of the tiny rice ball. when i picked up the sushi with my chopsticks, the sushi immediately felling apart. The sashimi were small and thin. It wasn't worth of $32. Also, the fresh wasabi they served, it reminds me of hot dog relish. 

Also, Arashi gave out a free bowl of edamame for each table. However, I saw the waiter just use his hand and grab a hand full of edamame and placed on the bowl. It was the same waiter who took our orders and after grab the edamame without washing his hand. The employees need to be more sanitary, specially when it's restaurant.
author: Stacy L.

description:
My friend and I ordered some vegetable tempura, the '49ers' roll (salmon, lemon, tobiko) and a 'Halloween ' roll (seaweed roll).

They had very reasonable prices for a small or large sake too.

Food was really tasty, we will definitely come back to try some other rolls next time we're in the city.

Restaurant is clean and simple. We were seated at the counter and could see they had just had a mix up with an order which the waitress and chefs handled professionally and quickly.
author: Wany X.

description:
Presentation looks good! 
Came here after learning about the restaurant on Groupon. Groupon is a good way to try new and old restaurants we otherwise wouldn't even know about. 

They get pretty busy at dinner! Make reservations. 

Sat at the bar. The food didn't wow me really, but the sushi chefs were friendly and courteous.
author: Veranna N.

description:
Like a lot of people who have reviewed this place I had a Groupon for the fixed dinner for two.  The deal itself was of great value but what really surprised me was the terrific service and quality of the fish.  The garlic edamame was some of the best I've had and the plum sake dish with shiso and jalapeno was amazing.  It was great to get to choose any two rolls you would like and not be limited to a reduced menu.  The crunchy lobster roll was totally bananas and had that saucy crunchy composure that many sushi rolls have.  Also got the Foxy roll, which was good, but missed the mark a bit on the mango it was supposed to deliver on.

Additionally, they have a Yelp check in deal for a free hot sake that they let us use in addition to the Groupon.  The service was quick, attentive, and helpful, and the ambiance was welcoming, clean, and modern.  Highly recommend grabbing this coupon and giving Arashi a shot, or, just stopping in for good sushi when you're in the area.  

More sushi places should consider putting together a Groupon that involves an affordable fixed menu/sampling with a little bit of customization so that the customer can leave experiencing an array of flavors on a sensible budget.
author: Sean S.

description:
I've had an undeniable desire for some good sushi for the past few weeks; it is suffice to say that I am sated. You might see some poor reviews complaining about their tempura or some other cooked dish. Begone with them, for an appetite for grease is not one served here. The real stars of the menu come in Arashi's creative, appetizers and fresh sashimi. Their Fish Tacos are an absolute must for any opener. They offer a changing menu of special catches, and great sashimi platters. 

This is one of my favourite sushi restaurants in San Francisco, mainly for their fresh sashimi and shellfish. Some of the best tasting sushi and shellfish I've ever eaten was from Arashi. They also have a pretty extensive variety of rolls, from rich and creamy to crispy, crunchy and savoury, even baked and vegetarian. They're great at accommodating groups of four or more; after all, the larger your group the more sushi you can try! 

You can expect some typical Japanese kitchen fare, if you're not in the mood for fish. Katsus, udon, ramen, teriyaki and tempura, it's all available. Their entrees are quite large though and most of them come with salad or rice, so you may not want a roll to accompany them. 

The atmosphere is casual and relaxed, televisions playing whatever sports game is on. They have a private room available with room for eight (but obviously call in advance). You can expect exceptional food and service; the owner's commitment to quality shines through and through. 

For the love of food, eat some raw fish!
author: Chris Y.

description:
This is a good sushi place to eat..the price is not bad...
They also closed late at night..Try it out...
author: Alex T.

description:
I really, really wanted this to be a 5-star sushi place because it's in a convenient location and because of the friendly staff.

I ordered a few items off of their extensive menu, and everything was good. Nothing stood out, but everything tasted good. I don't remember exactly what I ordered, as I went off of the waiter's recommendations. The fish tasted fresh and was plated with style. The service was great - my water was refilled, a hot miso soup and warm edamame were brought out while I waited for my order, and someone kept checking up on me.

However, the portions were tiny for the price. I'm all for quality, so initially, I was OK with the little bit of food I received, and I ordered more.  However, I felt quite sick an hour or two after my dinner, so I'm not so sure about the freshness of the ingredients used. I'm not sure if I'll be back or whether I'd recommend this place to friends.
author: Nelya T.

description:
They use the imitation crab, and the crunchy lobster roll definitely did not taste like lobster. The crunchy lobster left a lot to be desired. 

The lion king was decent- a bit too cheesy tasting for my taste. I'm not even sure what's on top of the baked salmon, but whatever kind of sauce it was, it was a little too much. 

When we first arrived, we were seated in an empty restaurant at a table that smelled strongly of cleaning supplies. My seat was wet so I had to switch my own chair with one at an adjacent table(because we didn't have napkins).
author: Julie M.

description:
How on Earth does this place have four stars? For the entire dinner I thought I was going to be the only one eating here. I did notice they had numerous delivery orders during my visit. Arashi has a cute private room up front for maybe eight people with a window view of the street. They have bar seating for six and an extended looking dining room with may be 12 tables total and the walls have three TVs on a sports channel.
.
The servers were great, prompt and attentive. I wished they would just put a teapot on the table; I was always on empty needing a refill. They do try so hard and even brought out the serving of white wine in a chilled glass.
.
The Garlic edamame was a new twist for me, okay, and may be just a bit oily. The dinner salad was really lacking and had only one half of one cherry tomato on it =(
.
A friend ordered the Hot Lady roll and had no comment...I ordered the Dragon roll and found it quite mediocre. The eel was too thin and small may be a half portion. The avocado also seemed skimpy but it did have quite a bit of roe. 
.
Nothing was bad just everything seemed so lacking and there is just so much better available in SF I hope I dont have to eat here again.
author: Caesar A.

description: I hate to post a negative review, but this sushi was incredibly fishy. I ordered take out from Arashi and had 4 rolls to try, all of which were unpalatable. I had to throw the entire order out after a few bites, which was such a complete waste of food and the fish who died in the process :( very disappointed with this experience.
author: Kelly L.

description: The food doesn't worth the price. The restaurant doesn't worth 4 stars. The sushi is super oily, taste is not that good jus soso, sushi is all cold even I order the baked sushi, and some of the sashimi is not as fresh. Take forever for the food to come even the sashimi dish. The cup have lipstick and still serve for customer. Show the server and the server was thinking we need napkin so she return with some napkin. So funny and then need to tell them to get another cup of tea and then she was like oh I thought you want some napkin. Lol. So stupid. Why would I want some napkin if the cup have lipstick on it. Order 3 rolls and 4 pieces scallop sashimi for two ppl and that's $90 something including tip. Super not worth it. Will not return again and will not recommend friends to go for sure.
author: Melinda L.

description:
This is a delivery review.

My ramen delivery order arrived in 16min! Crazy! It was also really good although I didn't expect quite so much garlic in the Chashu Ramen. Next time I'll ask them to tone it down a bit. That said, there will definitely be a next time.
author: Mariko F.

description:
Ordered for delivery tonight.

They forgot the green tea cheese cake :( not only was i excited for it, but it was also $5+... 

The driver also didnt "deliver" as he made me go to his car to get the food. Not a big deal but it was just kinda weird. Anyway, i probably wont be returning or ordering after a $28+ meal with missing stuff.
author: Shira S.

description:
First timer, bought a groupon. 

I was really excited to come here on a date with my boyfriend. 

Upon entering the restaurant on a Saturday night it was pretty empty. We thought it was strange when it's rated 4 stars on Yelp. Hm, maybe we beat the crowd. Lots of Togo orders and only one waitress. 

Food:

Do not order the salmon sashimi! 
The salmon sashimi was disgusting. It was very chewy. I wanted to throw up. Nothing was really good here. My favorite thing was the complimentary salted edamame. This place is expensive and has bad quality fish. 

The tea cups are really small, so we had to refill our tea a lot. I wish they gave us a pot, so we didn't have to keep asking for refills. 

Interior:

Really plain walls with a few shelves behind the sushi chefs with empty alcohol bottles on display. 

I really wanted to like this place but I'll stick with buying the groupon for sakesan on clement instead. The rolls there are delicious! For the same price you pay here you can't better quality food at sakesan.
author: Helen C.
