description: Food was mediocre. The best part of the meal was the California roll. Everything else was small portioned and tasted kind of funky. Maybe we came at a bad time but definitely would not be coming back anytime soon.
author: Ada H.

description: I ordered delivery from this restaurant. The food they sent me made my quite ill. Shortly after eating my food, I could feel my stomach turning. I spent the rest of my afternoon in excruciating stomach pain thereby ruining the rest of my afternoon and evening. Eventually, the pain was so bad I vomited it all back up. When I reached out for a refund, they were adamant that the food was "prepared correctly." If this is what the restaurant considers prepared correctly, I would STRONGLY advise that you spend your money somewhere else. If I could rate this restaurant lower than 1 star, I totally would. 0/5 (unless you like vomiting your guts out after eating).
author: Nick D.

description:
We ordered delivery from this place and all the rolls we ordered were really good and fresh tasting! Just placed my second order this week!

We ordered the spider roll, the 49er, and philly roll. The spider is really good and unique from others because it includes shiso leaf. The other rolls were solid, standard, and simple in the best way. Sometimes other places try so hard with the rolls and add too much sauce or they lack flavor but Arashi just does it right - fresh and solid.
author: Julie T.

description:
I ordered delivery from here and fell in love with the garlic edamame, teriyaki salmon dinner, tempura fried lobster roll, shrimp tempura, miso soup and philly rolls! Yes...that's right, I fell in love with it all! I actually ordered this sushi twice in a row it was so good and the best part is the prices are reasonable while the quality remains exceptional! 

The sushi was made pro style and the rice was perfectly firm! It had the right dryness and stickiness to keep the rolls right and tight. 

Nothing tastes fishy at ALL, just clean pure notes of freshness on the palate. As a super picky eater with somewhat ridiculous textural standards when it comes to sushi, I noticed that if I really like what I'm able to find in a good sushi house...most others appreciate it as well.
author: Love L.

description: Loved the variety of options and presentation. Also easy to get a table and Groupon made it so affordable. Thank you!
author: Eve H.

description:
I cannot believe this restaurant has 4 stars... I came here because I bought a groupon for this place. Even with the groupon for our party of 2 it was still quite expensive for the amount of food they give you.

We order 3 different rolls, which were quite small considering how they each costed over 10$. The first roll that arrived was the bay scallop roll, which was pretty good so we had high hopes for the other 2 rolls. Our 2nd roll was the volcano roll, which was very bland and the worst part was that the salmon was disgustingly chewy to the point that we did not even want to eat it. The volcano roll was also very poorly constructed to the point where the rolls were falling apart and they also gave us extremely tiny pieces of unagi in it. Our last roll was the halloween roll, which also had the same disgusting chewy salmon in it. 

In addition to the bad food, our server was also very slow with service when there were hardly any other people there. They also gave us wrong food that belonged to another table twice. After eating such nasty rolls, we never want to come back here again.
author: Andy Z.

description: Freshly made sushi, with portions of good size. There is a smell inside of the place, but that's the only draw back.
author: Alena N.

description: The Ankimo was so good~~~ i would go back just for that. a good place to hang out with friends
author: Xinwei C.

description: S.f sushi seriously sucks. The rice is God awful and it does not taste fresh. There may be plenty of Japanese folk portraying *sushi* goers, but no way. Bleh. Good for Mexican, and rare spots only.
author: Victoria V.

description:
If you arrive early, ASK FOR THE HAPPY HOUR MENU!

This is one of my go to sushi places in SF.  The fish is always super fresh. Their Albacore (white tuna) is amazing. Its like butter! Oh yeah, the butter fish is pretty good too! Try the FISH TACOS! Better here than anywhere else I've tried. Better than the one at Skool! They also offer real snow crab as an option.  It makes a HUGE difference with any roll that has imitation crab.   They have too many rolls I like to list right now.  Their shitake yakitori skewers are delicious too.
author: Rob L.

description: We first time here,food is fresh and delicious,service is excellent,prices are reasonable,lots of choices on the menu and seating is comfortable. Love this restaurant and enjoy introducing friends to here too.
author: Ka Ming L.

description: I been here twice and both times we had a groupon deal.  The people who work here are friendly and attentive.  They were always making sure our teacups were filled. We had the Sakura Roll, Romeo & Juliet, and the Spider Crab Roll.  All were delicious and fresh-tasting.  It appears to me the business survives through apps such as Groupon or Eat24 and other delivery apps.  Each time I came here it was always empty.  I do like this place and I will definitely come back!
author: Emi K.

description:
I thinkni order here every other week sense i move to the area... My guilty pleasure.... The other think i like to point out... Is i havent even walk in here yet. I alway uss eat24 app and always vet what i ask for. And my wait time is with in reason sense i live with in 2 miles . 

Again i get food from here pretty much every other week.
author: Seaera T.

description:
Good, affordable sushi in a cute restaurant

Went to Arashi on a Friday night with two friends. It was very busy, but they honored our reservation right away. Service was friendly and efficient all night. We shared a delicious seaweed salad and each ordered our own dinners ). All of the food was good. Not EXCELLENT, but good. Definitely great for the price. I look forward to returning to Arashi in the near future.
author: Zipeng C.

description:
1 star for the nice delivery man.

This food is so awful.  I had to throw my $50 order away because it was such crap.  The seafood upon consisted of dry, mysterious meats.  The rolls (tekka, spicy tuna, romeo & juliet) have some nasty ass basil or mint in there?  Wtf?  Way to ruin your rolls...& my evening.  

After a few bites of everything, I couldn't stomach the thought of eating such shit.
author: BizzyLizzy K.

description: Decent service. She gave me a good sake suggestion based on my preference. Sushi was good. I like that they have garlic edamame, that's not that common. It's unfortunate they aren't open at lunch anymore, I'd be there more often if they were.
author: Kris F.

description:
Looking for good sushi on a Monday night during the holiday season? Don't bother haha. I found it near impossible and I learned this the hard way. I knew I should have stopped trying after the fifth sushi restaurant on Yelp that was closed. 

After driving through the Richmond, we finally just settled for Arashi and it was just what I expected...overpriced mediocre sushi. :( I ordered the 8 piece sake toro sashimi for $14.95 (only $1 more than regular sake sashimi) and it was actually really fresh, but pieces were cut pretty small. I'm so glad I ordered the toro because I traded one piece for my bf's regular sake from his Chirashi and it was so much better. We also shared Tamago nigiri and the Sunset roll (cucumber instead of rice, avocado, tuna, salmon, and another fish I can't remember). The Sunset roll only came with 5 pieces at $8.95. The ends of the rolls had a decent amount of fish, but the three pieces in the middle, not so much. Avocado was also lacking. There wasn't much flavor to the roll either. 

The service was on the slow side even though the restaurant was almost empty. Mostly disappointing meal, but I did like their sake toro. Just wish there was more of it! I probably won't be back.
author: Stephanie G.

description: Every item on the menu that I tried is very good. The fish tacos is amazing. He servers are friendly and very nice. I definitely recomend this place.
author: Ron A.

description:
Took a gamble on this new place and came up short unfortunately. 

Apparently the night before was a busy one for them so upon arrival, they informed us they were out of all special fishes and only had the basics. There were nice lunch specials but overall wasn't impressed with the fish. 

My friend got the omakase (ended up getting a shipment in after we ordered) and I got the chirashi, spicy scallop hand roll and white out roll. My fam had the table right next to me and we were 2 out of 4 tables seated in the restaurant. 

Service was slow given the few number of patrons.. Both of our tables didn't get food until 45 mins after being seated. Their omakase tasted fishy and didn't seem to be cleaned well. My friend had to force the food down and was pretty disappointed he ordered it. My chirashi was good (basic fish) but the rice was soggy. 

Overall it's decent but there's much better out there.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
This is a new restaurant and the food was nicely prepared. The staff is friendly enough and the rolls were yummy enough to take the leftovers home for later tonight. But they dropped a star for how they handled the misleading deals they were offering on the internet.

Unfortunately, since they offered what they thought was the same deal on Groupon, Living Social and Amazon Local, they were surprised to discover Amazon Local's deal (for the same price) was completely different and they just didn't honor it and told us Amazon got it wrong. They just gave us the Groupon deal. I would have rather had the Amazon deal but oh well.

So they handed us a special Groupon sampler menu of five appetizers and one small sample roll per person from a special paper menu they give to people with deals. Hard to figure out what it's worth since this menu didn't have prices and was a sampler meal so not for regular customers but they claim it's $53 worth of food. (They also make the customer pay for sales tax on the full value of the meal (the $53) on top of whatever else you order, and then even charge sales tax on that sales tax which I'm pretty sure is wrong.)

We live a couple blocks away and are always trying the new places so when I noticed this new restaurant where the cajun place was (too bad 'cause they were good) I wanted to try it. We liked the food and may come back but not with a "deal." Having lived in Japan for many years I can say this is not as good as other Japanese restaurants in our neighborhood like Daigo, Minami, or even Joo Mak a block away.
author: Kira B.

description: Business closed during Yelp showing "open" hours on Saturday and Sunday. No one picked up phone calls. Not sure what's going on.
author: Runner L.

description:
I came here using a Groupon Deal to eat a meal that was supposedly worth around $100 of sushi, but it definitely seemed like they were ripping us off. Under different circumstances, the meal would have been more worth my money than this Groupon deal but luckily it was a Groupon Deal so it was not too absurd.  

Still, I thought the service was great and the food was not bad. We had a set of appetizers come with our meal and we had the option of choosing four sushi rolls. The appetizers included garlic edamame, which was unique and pretty good. There was also tempura, miso soup, and salmon sashimi. The miso soup was too salty for my taste. We ordered the Temptation, Spider, Super Dynamite, and Sunset. The Sunset tasted fresh and unique because it was a roll without rice.
author: Regina L.

description:
I've dined at this place three times since it opened. First time I time was on its third day if business, and most recently last night. This has established itself as another one of my favorite sushi places, one that I'll likely come quite regularly. I love their omakase, especially their eight piece nigiri version where you get eight different kinds of fish for  I think $23.95 (this is in contrast to the 12 piece sashimi version where you get only six kinds but two pieces each). You get "non-regular" sushi items shipped from Japan. According to the main chef every week they get a shipment of assorted kinds. Weekend selection are likely to be better than weekdays for now, also according to the chef.

Last night I ordered the clam soup and that was great also, very different from other sushi places I ordered that from. That will likely be another must order whenever I come.

This place is worthy of five stars for the food. The reason I am giving only four stars for now is that the service still seems a little challenged, even when the restaurant is only a little more than half full. They left the clam soup on the counter for a long time and didn't bring it until I asked about it, therefore allowing it too much time to cool. I also ordered a hot sake, though not with the original order, and the young lady staffperson totally forgot and I had to ask a different guy later on. It seems the fact they do delivery and takeout may be taking away too much focus.  Hope it's just growing pains and they overcome it.
author: H K.

description: Friends ordered here and I remembered my previous experiences, so I only ordered veggie rolls and tempura shrimp. Things just aren't prepared well but if you're desperate for sushi you can order here for grocery store quality sushi and I don't recommend getting the fish.
author: Emma M.

description:
Went here for a friends birthday last night and happy hour today. The house sake is a little harsh, and the firecracker roll was made with canned tuna. 

Despite this, the roll was delicious and both times the service was great.
author: Danielle B.

description:
I rarely leave reviews, but this deserves a review . I ordered from the lunch special a Chirashi , deluxe sashimi combo ,salmon sashimi. 
Chirashi - 12.95 , include thin slice of white tuna, red tuna, shrimp , salmon, tamago and rice . Nice and fresh 
8piece salmon-13.95 . Again soo fresh, and the slices are pretty generous. 
Deluxe sashimi/sushi - 8 piece sashimi , 2 of each , chef choice.  Each piece was fresh. Plus choice of Cali or spicy tuna roll (6 pieces)
author: Joyce C.

description: Everything is great here. Last night I tried the midnight oysters for the first time - amazing, rich, and super tasty. My faves usually revolve around their house special rolls (forest roll!? Elf roll!!?) and anything fried - but in particular, and the veggie Dragon roll!
author: Mable L.

description:
My wife wanted to try this place out so we went with a few others for a party of 8.  Usually, I''m the cursed sushi person in any group and often don't get my food until the rest of the party is done.  This time was vastly different.  The food was ok and standard for any sushi restaurant.  I really wanted to give them a 4 for service and 3 for food.  I'm not sure it its because we went on a Monday night but the sushi rice seemed past its prime and was a bit dry. 

We started with the raw tofu, which you really can't mess up, and also had the Chicken Kara-age and Gyoza.  Standard stuff with the chicken with a siracha mayo dipping sauce.  The Gyoza was packaged standard fare, but cooked well with a nicely seared wrapper.  One of the stars was garlic edamame which we quickly consumed.  

Our table had the salmon sashimi which came beautifully plated on shisho leaves and thickly sliced Jalapenos in the center.  While tasty, we would have preferred more thinly sliced peppers.

We ordered an assortment of rolls and my wife had the deep fried tuna roll.  This was fried to within an inch of its life.  The technique plus the rice left most of this roll uneaten.  

I'll go back, but probably on a busier night.
author: Dude D.

description:
Dropped in for lunch and were blown away. Super fresh sushi- great portions- superb service.
Easy street parking at noon - bring quarters.
They were gracious enough to accept our Groupon  coupon ( we didn't see dinner only addendum) 
Cant wait to return. Hands down, the best sushi ( huge menu) we have had in ages.
author: Miami S.

description: Great sushi!! We tried because of the Groupon & we like exploring different sushi spots. We always order nigiri, sashimi, some rolls & sake & we definitely enjoyed it all here!! Everything also was a great price as we normally spend more on sushi in the area! Great sake oyoko don & the volcano roll was fire (literally & figuratively)! Tuna Lovers roll, Warriors roll & 49er roll were also perfect. (:
author: Lindsey D.

description:
We got this via Zesty. Loved the vegan platter!
Avo Maki, Veggie Dragon, Sweet Potato Maki, Kappa Maki, Futo Maki
author: Sagar J.

description:
This is my favorite sushi place in the Richmond. I mainly stick to the sushi items, but I have also tried the teriyaki plates and udon. Overall the menu is extremely varied, fresh, and delicious. 

The customer service is excellent. All of the wait staff I've encountered are friendly, efficient, and accommodating. 

Also their happy hour prices are a steal! But the normal hour prices are very reasonable as well. 

Pro tip: get the garlic edamame.
author: Heidi Q.

description:
My first time eating here and I am very happy. The sashimi was fresh and service was great. The staff are friendly and knowledgable about the food. The place is cozy and nice too.

Fish taco and beef tattaki was my favorite! Love their specials too. Overall I give this place 5 thumbs up!
author: BiBiamn V.

description:
I like this place! Just randomly walked by, after enjoying some adult beverages outside on a beautiful day... and I was pleasantly surprised. Oh, and I also found a really good deal. $17 for 4 sushi rolls or something crazy like that.

Affordable sushi for the quality and lots of fantastic deals currently going on for everyone's budget to give it a shot. 

Sushi tasted fresh and expansive choice of rolls and other Japanese delicacies. Conveniently located a few blocks from me, so when I am switching it up from Sushi Bistro or don't feel like waiting long, I will head here :)
author: Katie P.

description:
Good Sushi, Good Service

We had a misunderstanding ordering but the staff took care of it and was very nice about it. The sushi was very good, this is a great neighborhood find that I would recommend you try.
author: Melody H.

description:
I went here with my mom for lunch.  For my mom she has a California roll while I had a Veggie Dragon and Garden Roll for both of us to share.  I can only comment on the Veggie Dragon and Garden Roll as I'm a vegan which both are really good!  The garden roll taste great.  Nothing exciting but gets the job done in filling you up.  

The Veggie Dragon was actually amazing!  It was a nice combination of flavor from the grilled thin sliced eggplant and avocado plus the crunchiness of the tempura sweet potato.  I think everyone even if you're a meat eater should give this roll a try!

Also overall service from the server was attentive and great!
author: Green C.

description: Very good and fresh sushi! Love it!! Will go all the times!! Good service and all giving smell !
author: jian le l.

description:
Stopped in for a dinner yesterday and it was fantastic!

We had 5 different  sashimi, sushi and 2 rolls !very reasonably priced for great tastig freshlu sushi.

Great friendly service also!
author: Grace P.

description:
Our favorite,go-to sushi place.
By habit,we star with the miso soup,edamame,and we'll order the salmon skin hand roll,some special fish (I can't remember the name) and three others.The fish is fresh and tasty! If you looking for great Japanese food and great sushi you can't go wrong here!
author: Bri G.

description: The service is great, they're attentive but not overbearing. Hands down the best beef teriyaki bento I've ever had! My boyfriend and I usually order that along with the beef tataki, chicken karage, a roll or two, and whatever else peaks our fancy (obviously too much for two). There's nothing that we've been disappointed by so far, and we eat here quite often!
author: K Y.

description:
Despite my bias towards Chinese-owned sushi restaurant, I think there are some basic things that could have done better at Arashi (based on my experience and observing other guests): tea/water is served slow, soy sauce on the sushi bar was not ready, same for wasabi. The guests next to me didn't get wasabi until the sushi was on the table and they asked for it; I got a ready-to-use fork with food on it (although I could tell it had been rinsed and dried in the machine)

Aside from these, fish is good and overall price is reasonable. I like the chef called Wilson or Vincent because he interacted with guests during my dinner. Also the waitress was very active and she checked with other guests about how they were doing.
author: Grizabella L.

description: I used to do take out here a lot. But they fell off hard.  They gave me some "tuna tataki" it was hard as rubber they refused to give me my money back. It smelled like three day old fish. I told them it 1) was not maguro 2) it's not fresh. They responded with the attached video as if I didn't know my fish. This restaurant has terrible service and terrible fish. Avoid at all cost.
author: Jesse J.

description:
We go to this place because of this one reason:
-great service. They know how to take care of you especially Ray who is the owner. He takes care of us and knows us now since we come there every week.

Food is good but SERVICE is always awesome and this place is now our go to.
author: Rick A.

description: After hearing about this place from friends, and reading all the reviews here, I decided to give this place a try. I was not disappointed. Everything I ordered was delicious. I had the omakase sushi (chef choice sushi) and my friend had the cha-shu ramen. The sushi taste great and fresh and the cha-shu ramen was delicious. Especially the rich flavor broth with fried garlic. There's a great vibe to this place and the service was great. Definitely plan on becoming a regular here!
author: Grace S.

description: We ordered two rolls: Forest and Dragon. On top of that we tried their salmon tacos since it was something different. The food was okay tasting but we were shocked by how small the rolls were. I'm glad we came using a $15 for $30 groupon because I felt we didn't get much for $30 worth of food. Unfortunately, because of this we won't come back.
author: Helen L.

description: First time here, wait staff are curteous, friendly and attentive.  Food was fresh and made to order and served promptly.
author: Harry T.

description:
I ordered a dragon roll which was decent.
The california roll I ordered with real crab seemed to have fake crab in it.
The escolar/butter fish sashimi was horrible.  I couldn't even eat one piece.  It was maybe the wrong cut for sushi?  This is usually a very tender melt in your mouth fish.  This was tough and my teeth couldn't cut through the fish!
So weird.

Also, the ginger had weird white goo inside it.
author: r t.

description:
we live in the neighborhood. and when I say neighborhood... 1blk away.  really wanted to like this place, I'm born & raised in the Richmond district & love supporting local businesses... But this place SUCKS.  

Here's why:
1. Food Poisoning: First time we tried, it was week #1 & got food poisoning. Tried to stay open minded & chalked it up to restaurant needing to get settled.
2. Obliterated Nigiri & Uni Don: Tonite we ordered delivery, being that we are literally 1blk away.  Yes lazy, but also have small children so it was a necessary luxury.  The order came 1.5hrs later AND the ENTIRE NIGIRI order came in shambles; as if someone shook the the box.  Think pile of fish & rice mixed up.  The Uni Don we ordered also showed up sideways. 
3. Terrible Customer Service: I called & spoke to the mgr, he said he would talk to his delivery guy but all he could do was offer me 20% off for my $100+ order (of which we ordered 10+ orders of nigiri).  When I asked for a refund on the items that came destroyed; the mgr response was 20% or nothing. 

I will not be going back.
author: Joelle L.

description: The X and the lobster crunchy rolls were SO GOOD. Free sake with yelp check-in and $17 for $30 Groupon deal. Ended up being a really cheap meal with great quality food.
author: Faye C.

description:
This review is for the Groupon deal (prix fixe menu). I was not impressed by anything we ordered there. My white soy sauce dish had a baby silverfish desperately trying to crawl out. Google search silverfish if you don't know what they look like... no, just no.

2 miso soups - mediocre, nothing special

Bowl of garlic edamame - tasty, but greasy

4 pieces of hiyashi tofu - not very flavorful/crispy

4 pieces of mix tempura - mediocre, nothing special

6 pieces of plum sake sashimi - some people like this dish, but I thought the sashimi was too fatty and I'm really not a big fan of plum sauce and the leaves on the bottom of the sashimi

One roll of choice per person - limited selection of sushi rolls from the Groupon menu

Items listed above definitely did not worth the $53 advertised on Groupon. One star for the food, another star for the service. No good reason to come back when there are so many great sushi places in the neighborhood (unless this is the only restaurant that opens in the midst of a zombie apocalypse).
author: Yummytummy W.

description: Service was great.  We had four different rolls.  Each one was delicious, especially the lobster roll.
author: Zhaobin Z.

description: Stopped by this place in the way to my hotel. It was good sushi and beer for a good price, happy hour prices till 6pm was nice. Decent service. No complaints. Small and quaint atmosphere.
author: M W.

description:
Everything was ordinary, but it was delivery...so, no minus points for that. I'm thinking it would be 3x better in restaurant. For delivery though, this was top notch.  

All I'm going to talk about is the curry dish, because everything else was good/okay, unremarkable. The katsu was crispy outside and moist inside. The flavor of the curry was complex, I even got the bay leaf (Good luck in my family haha). There was substance and I could tell it wasn't just thrown together. Honestly, it's better than the curry I make, and I make great curry. It's not as good as like two other places I've been to, but that's personal preference. Plus, deliiiiiiiivery ~ ありがとう、嵐。
author: Vanessa H.

description:
I bought a $26 living social deal for $53 worth of food  and decided to use it today. Although the food wasn't bad and the fish could of been more fresh I thought the service was pretty good. This review is more to inform people of this living social/groupon deal because after eating there I was a bit curious to know if my meal was really worth $53 so I did some calculation. Also, I wanted to say that these prices are taken from the menu prices taken from the yelp pictures that was listed 5 months ago so I'm not exactly sure if they change the prices to meet the $53. 
Here's what I order

Sunset roll- 8.95
Temptation roll- 8.95
Age dashi tofu- 4.50
Mix tempura- 5.95 (menu offers 8 piece, pre fix is only 6)
Garlic edamame -4.95
Miso soup- 1.95 x2
Plum salmon sashimi- not listed on the menu, but if you compare it to the other similar dish it will probably be 9.95 -10.95 tops.

So now let's add it up with out the plum salmon- the total is 37.20, let's say the plum salmon is 9.95 it would be 47.15. This is still not close to $53. I also want to mention I order the 2 most expensive roll at $8.95 each, image if you picked the one that are only 5.95 -6.50, you are even further away from the $53. 

So although the deal is not by any means ripping us off, it is very misleading considering it is really not worth $53 worth of food. At this point, I rather have you let me order up to $53, than create a menu that is actually not worth that much. 

To end this review. I give this place 2 and a half stars and have to think twice about coming back mainly cause it bothers me about the deal they are advertising.
author: Angela T.

description: 1 star off for service (worst I have ever had in a restaurant, she barely spoke English and forgot or messed up half our orders) but the food is definitely A+ especially for the price, I recommend the omakase or the fish tacos
author: Jessica S.

description:
The quality of the food here is amazing. Not to mention the staff is very friendly. 
They have good hours, clean location, and delivery. I used to go here when it was the rockin crawfish, but was happy they filled the spot with even better seafood.
author: Nicholas D.

description: I looked for a Japanese restaurant close to where I was staying and found this awesome restaurant. I had two rolls that were amazing: volcano and dragon. I would absolutely come back.
author: Ines Z.

description:
This review is for delivery through GrubHub.
Ordered at 9:10PM, estimated delivery between 10:15PM and 10:25PM. Nothing at 10:35PM and impossible to reach GrubHub customer service. 
The delivery guy finally arrives at 10:50 and the first things he says is: tip!
When I ask what took so long he replies "English no good". Sure...
Well his tip was certainly no good as well.
Food was OK though.
author: Adrien P.

description: The food was delicious and fresh! Great presentation and attentive staff. We had various sashimi which all tasted wonderful. Fish tacos were also great and crunchy. I especially loved the grilled steak we had also ordered. I would most definitely return again!
author: Juliana H.

description: The fish didn't taste all that fresh, but the lion king roll was pretty good. Definitely average for the neighborhood. Worth trying the groupon deal for sure. Edamame on the house which was a nice touch. Probably not worth getting the garlic edamame which wasn't that special.
author: Ann Z.

description: I didn't think it was fresh, and felt the flavors were unremarkable. That said - it was delivery and often the food changes flavor and texture when sitting in the to-go boxes for a while. I'd try it again in the restaurant.
author: Ryan K.

description:
Tried this spot out because there was a good Groupon deal for a prix fixe dinner for 2 (set appetizers and you pick 2 rolls). But sadly, I was pretty disappointed with Arashi. 

The appetizers were just okay. The best thing I had was the garlic edamame, but even those I kind of wished they served were warm not cold. The set came with this plum salmon sashimi that I really did not care for. It had this green leaf or lettuce with a lemon slice and a drip of this strange sour red sauce on top of really thin sliced salmon. I really wished it was just some salmon by itself. Their agedashi tofu wasn't bad, but I've had better. Shrimp and veggie tempura was pretty on par and the dipping sauce was good.

Now for the sushi rolls. They tasted good, but had way too much rice. The rice should just be able to wrap around the filling inside, but the rice rolled over that and overlapped. (Imagine like the rice kind of made a spiral.) 

Don't believe I'll be coming back here.
author: Sharon L.

description:
Wanted to give this place a try since I saw they delivered and there was a groupon deal going on to get me in their door and try the food. Little did I know until I sat down, the deal was for a prix fix menu. If you ask me half off for a prix fix menu with VERY minimal selection is NOT a deal! I would of much rather just got the $ back and used it to order whatever I wanted. This menu had nothing I would normally order... maybe the miso soup. It just left me kicking myself I failed to read fine print. Nonetheless I gave it a fair shot since I had the groupon and was sitting in their restaurant. 

To start off service was not good. No utensils or plates. I ordered sake and didn't get until I had to remind them in the middle of my meal. They also forgot to give me my sashimi from my prix fix menu but because the meal was so disappointing I didn't even notice until left and was like "hey.... they never gave us our picked sashimi" (whatever that is...). I also had ordered some additional things since the prix fix was crappy but let me just say I should've stopped right there.

I ordered two additional things: the Butterfish Carpaccio; one word - UNDERWHELMING. But what really was the nail in the coffin was the server bringing us out grey uni. I stared at it for a bit wondering why it was that color? I should of eaten it but I did. Grey uni = decomposing uni. 

All in all... a frustrating experience with no fresh fish. Why would I go here when there are 1,001 better places in the outer richmond. Thanks but no thanks.
author: Crystal S.

description:
We ordered yam tempura roll, California roll, miso soup, and Chicken udon. According to the menu, the chicken udon was made from deep fried chicken and vegetables. The chicken was boiled, not deep fried, and the only vegetable was cabbage! No broccoli, carrots, nothing else but cabbage! 

The rice for the sushi rolls tasted a bit sour. Probably too much vinegar. The yam tempura tasted like it had been made earlier today. Not fresh at all.

The miso soup was just OK

I would not recommend this restaurant.
author: Teresa D.

description: First time here, wait staff courteous, friendly and attentive.  Food was fresh, made to order and promptly served.
author: Mia Y.

description: I have ordered sushi to go a few times from this spot and am never disappointed. The beef teriyaki is amazing and so are the Philadelphia and California rolls. Delivery time usually takes a little over an hour but it is worth the wait.
author: Corinne S.

description: Check out groupon, they have had a groupon deal for quite some time now. After my first dining experience, I went to order another deal. Came here on a Monday night and it was pretty busy. Didn't have to wait long for a table but the space got filled up pretty quickly. The groupon deal was a prie fix although you get to select 2 rolls of your choice from the special prie fix menu. Service was quick. Food came out quick. The sushi was very fresh. We ordered the butterfish cappacio on the side and we would order again. We also had the miso soup, assorted tempura with shrimp and veggies and tofu agashi.A great deal and great food!
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description:
This evening, we were one of three tables. We received:
Poor service
Do not attend to their guest 
Unclean table
Food on chairs
Dirty place settings 
Smaller portions if you use Groupon
author: Arlene L.

description: The only thing I gotta say about this place is the omakase was so good! And the best part of it wS the blue fin tuna!!! OHHH man if only had just that I would order it haha!
author: Herman L.

description:
Nice place great food . The service was wonderful very attentive. We had a mixed tempura a beef terriaki dinner miso soup and sushi. A sweet place good portions and very quite
 The gave us edamame on the house . Nice people will be back
author: Stef M.

description: I came in on a Tuesday about 6 pm with a Groupon ($30). The place is very casual with a sports bar in front and lots of small tables all around. I ordered  a Chirachi Don (assorted sashimi with rice and dacon radish noodles), $16.95; a salmon and avocado hand roll, $3.95; and a large hot saki,  $6.75. Everything was very fresh. The churachi had good chunks of salmon, tuna, albacore, yellow fin and egg. Yummy :) With the Groupon, it was a great deal.
author: Me Like Good Food S.

description:
3.5 stars. 

From reading the reviews on the groupon deal, I was REALLY hesitant to come in to redeem and all the "awesome" reviews were done by people who don't really have a consistent or trustworthy (more than a handful of reviews) yelp account. 

The groupon deal is (still running as of 1.05.15) $26 for $53 dollars worth of food and includes the following: 

2 miso soups
Bowl of garlic edamame
4 pieces of hiyashi tofu (which is now agedashi tofu)
4 pieces of mix tempura
6 pieces of plum sake sashimi
One roll of choice per person

They were pretty specific on what you get for your meal. The roll of your choice is of course, rolls from the cheaper end of the menu ($9 and under). They have additional rolls for $9+, which is pretty typical of sushi places around the area. We decided on the Bay Scallop in addition to our meal, which ran for $11.95. 

The service was good, mainly because we were the only ones here on a Sunday night. The other table left before we ordered our food. It was a tad awkward that the staff outnumbered us. This is a Chinese run, Japanese restaurant... pretty sure because they were all chattering away in Chinese during our entire meal. 

Miso soup: average, not super piping hot but nothing special from any other restaurant
Bowl of garlic edamame: super garlicky, and pretty tasty unless you hate garlic
4 pieces of hiyashi tofu (which is now agedashi tofu): it's not normal agedashi tofu, it's delicate on flavor (or bland, depending how strong you typically expect the broth to be. I've definitely had better elsewhere)
4 pieces of mix tempura: there were more than "four" pieces: 2 ebi tempura, 2 zucchini, 1 yam, 1 broccoli. It wasn't super crispy like I like, and the sauce was whatever. 
6 pieces of plum sake sashimi: This was the star of the groupon, it was really good. The waiter also suggests that you don't add soy sauce, and I agree. It was delicious. I would come back for this alone (but I didn't see it on their normal menu)
Spider Roll: over sauced, not super pretty but still good. 
Temptation: oversauced as well, pretty decent. 

I got this groupon for a steal since there was an additional 20% code on top of the already discounted price so I'm not going to complain. All in all, the place isn't bad and that plum sake sashimi was great. I should come back for just the sashimi. They advertise that its flown in from Japan (I'm highly skeptical but we shall see!).
author: Jeannie L.

description:
We got found this place on groupon. The deal was alright but service was so so bad. The waitress kept taking the plates when we weren't done. She also reached over us and got her hair in the food. 

They also charged tax on groupon value and not on the value you actually pay. 

Bottom line is there are so many good Japanese restaurants in the Richmond. Stay away from this place.
author: Lily J.

description: It's a decent neighborhood joint.  Nothing special, but decent enough if you're too lazy to drive elsewhere.  Seems to have lots of Eat24 orders.  Please note this is a non Japanese owned spot.
author: Joel M.

description: You gotta check this spot. Freshest sushi in the Richmond. Really friendly staff. Great Happy hour. Solid choice
author: Greg D.

description:
3.5 star. Only because of there Ankimo with ponzu sauce. Others? : bleh!!! 
Service? Okay.
Price? Expensive!!! for the quality of the fish especially the sashimi. Not so fresh. We ordered 1 chefs choice sashimi, 1 chicken teriyaki, 2 oysters and 1 ankimo for LUNch and the bill was 47$ / plus tip so over 50$ 
 I dont think Im going to come back here again.
author: Diem M.

description:
Ordered for delivery and the food took 2+ hours to arrive. The sushi rice was mushy and over cooked. Prices are relatively cheap but fish cuts were also small. I probably won't be back.

If you are going to be more than double the expected delivery time, you should call the customer to let them know of the delay.
author: Lester W.

description: This place has great groupon/living social deals if you can find them. Way out in the Inner Richmond unfortunately.
author: Jane H.

description: I live very close by the new Japanese restaurant Arashi sushi house...so I give it a try... It definitely did not disappointed me !!! the sushi chef recommend me to try the omakase sashimi. I had haven't try any of it from other places before!!! It just taste so fresh!! And not fishy at all!!! And I ordered couple appetizer and special rolls!! They were very delicious too!!! Decent food .good decoration. Great service! I will come back to arashi for sure!!!
author: Hibby T.

description: I love the price point and the sushis I have experienced here (especially the toros, stay away from the rolls...someone doesn't know how to roll and way too much rice) , but whenever I order delivery, all of my hot foods arrive ICE COLD. I'm not talking warm, or slightly cool, it's like they have been in a cooler for the ride from the Inner Sunset to the Outer Sunset. I think I'm going to take a break from ordering here, until they can fix that issue.
author: emma g.

description: Got delivery from here through Eat24 and it took over TWO HOURS.  Hangry doesn't come close to describing the hunger and frustration I felt at 9:15 on a Wednesday with no dinner.  When it did finally arrive, all the sushi was warm - not like slightly chilled, just straight up WARM.  I was actually afraid to eat it since everything I ordered was raw but I was too hungry not too.  Well, I didn't even finish it because everything tasted so bad.  Even if it was the right temperature I'm not sure it would be anything out of the ordinary.  Sushi lovers beware...
author: Lindsey G.

description:
Ok so the lower rating is only for the groupon and service.  

3* The groupon for 4 is not worth it. As mentioned in other reviews, the sushi menu is limited with the groupon. I also agree that these rolls seemed a bit smaller that the regular roll.  So if you get 4 different rolls there's no way that you get to the amount of the groupon said price.  The food was good.  But they charge sales tax on the full amount of the groupon, with a confusing explanation of how they lower that amount when they tax it again with the full bill. We ordered 1 more roll as it was not on the limited list of sushi. Total bill including groupon, tax and tip came out to $75...Which is just ok for what we got. Could have gone to another restaurant w better quality and gotten the same amount.

3* Service was also really rushed. They kept bringing out dish after dish and forced us to hurry up and finish plates so they could add more to the table. The first 6 dishes were pushed on us within 17 min. I mean who eats that fast.  The waitress was standing at our table trying to get us to hurry or move stuff over to another plate. It was half empty and seemed unnecessary. 

4* the food was decent...nothing mind blowing BUT I might go back for the buttery fresh sashimi we tried as well as the regular rolls.
author: Sharra C.

description: Totally would order from here again!!!!  LOOOOOVED IT!  The Gyoza were a little small but so tasty!  We'll be ordering from here again.  :-)
author: Lissette T.

description: Ordered for delivery through Eat24 and the order came earlier than expected. We had ordered quite a few rolls, hand rolls, and appetizers, and everything tasted fresh and flavorful. The portion sizes were great, as a few other sushi joints we've dined at tend to make very small rolls. We had some leftovers for the next day and the rolls still tasted as great as the day before. Would definitely order again and even dine in store.
author: Alison L.

description:
Came for the groupon ($17 for $30 worth of food), left full and happy. 

Started off with garlic edamame and vegetable tempura, both are highly recommended if you like garlic and/or tempura. The tempura included a jalapeño which as a spicy food lover, was amazing. If you don't like spicy food, there were still a plethora of other veggies to enjoy.

We also got the crazy monkey (added jalapeño because of commentary above) and crispy CA roll. Bomb.com -- highly recommend both.

Service was very prompt and polite as one would expect from a Japanese restaurant.

Definitely would go back -- with or without the groupon.
author: Jordan S.

description:
A night hot as hell. A political debate adding to the hot air in the room. No way we wanted to cook. It's Monday so our favorite Chinese place is closed, and one of my children will only eat Chinese food from there. It's complicated. So we look at Japanese food. Arashi Sushi. Arashi means storm or tempest - usually with dark overtones. I had always been leery of it. It's like Tsunami Sushi - I don't care how good it is you don't name a place after a disaster.

But we needed to eat so I went to eat24 to order food. Menu looked good so we figured out what to get and placed our order, only to be told that it's CLOSED. Say what?

So I called. No, there were just busy and were only taking orders for themselves. I placed the order and before I had said ten words they said "delivery will be 60-90 minutes". Well you know what? I'm invested in this now so I said that I would come pick it up. I was willing to give up the parking space. "30 minutes"

I got there in 20. The food was ready. Same price. 3 bags. We got the food home and dug in.

I can't speak to the sushi. We didn't have any. My oldest had the Chicken Teriyaki. My youngest had the Chicken Don. My wife had the Katsu Don. I had the Ton Katsu. Yes, there was a pattern but so what. This is my review damn it.

The portions were generous. The taste was spot on - we eat a lot of Japanese food and this was solid stuff. We all cleaned our plates and had food left over. The Teriyaki sauce was the right balance of sweet and spicy, and the Katsu sauce was as good as any you could find in a Japanese market.

We fed 4 large people for just a hair over $50.00. We ate well, we enjoyed the experience, and we will order from them again. What else could you ask for?

Oh, and my parking space was still there we I got back home. A good night all in all.

美味しかったですよ。また食べて行くよ。ありがとう！
author: James R.

description: I came here a few times. The food was better than I expected. Ambiance was warm and welcoming. I sat by the bar the chef was knowledgeable and friendly. Great staff and not to mention their food was fresh reasonable priced. Will definitely visit again to try specialty and Sushi on the meal. Overall great experience would recommend
author: Alan W.

description:
Delicious Sushi and Rolls.
They have deep fried which I just love.They deliver too. I have had them twice and both times were deliveries.

#1 choice for delivery Sushi.  Not sure of the actual location and ambiance but the food is amazing :)
author: Kimia R.

description:
It's rare that a restaurant meets all my expectations. This place has it all!

Food is Amazing!
Free Edamame!
Free unlimited tea! Oh and by the way, it's delicious.
Price is low.
Customer service is lightning fast!
Desert is to dream for! We had the green tea ice cream! We were fighting over it! And I'm lactose intolerant! 
Place has a good energy to it.
Best sushi rolls in San Francisco! The fiesta roll was phenomenal!

They have a lifetime customer! Thank you!
author: Johnny C.

description: Great food..!!we really enjoyed our meal here,the sushi and sashimi were outstanding and the servers were spot on. We will definitely be back.
author: Angel M.

description:
This restaurant was... Truly surprising!!  And by that, I mean it was excellent.  Even at 7pm, the quality of the sushi was excellent.  It seemed like they only used the good parts of the fish just for me...which is awesome!!

The garlic edamame...very good.  I had two full bowls of that alone!  It was gone very quickly.

Also, the volcano roll was HUGE!  A lot more than I expected.

Overall, this restaurant was a VERY pleasant surprise.
author: Antonio A.

description:
This place has on my bookmark list since it opened and I recently bought a dinner deal for two from livingsocial! It had an awesome prix fix menu-miso soup, appetizers, 2 rolls of your choice, and plum sake sashami!

 I LOVED the garlic edamame that it came with! I never knew how delicious a little addition of garlic can be to the already delicious edamame. My next favorite was definitely the plum sake sashami!! It was more on the lemon-y side of things so if you're not a fan of sour things, this may not be your favorite item. But I absolutely love anything lemon flavored and I thought it was a wonderful addition to the salmon. I don't exactly remember what I got for the rolls itself but the fish was fresh and the sauces they used complemented well with the fish. They weren't very consistent about the amount of rice in each of the rolls though so some pieces came out to be almost the size of my palm! Great price for the dinner though!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
We were in the area the other night and decided to give this restaurant a try. The sashimi was fresh and had came in large portions. The waitress was super nice and made small talk with us all night.

if you're a fan of sashimi, you have to order the sashimi deluxe. also ordered the 49er roll , hamachi carpachio, and blue fin toro and each was delicious. I'm coming back next week!
author: Wilson L.

description:
had this place bookmarked to try and it was pretty good. the whole set up and ambiance is nice. clean and cozy. there is bar seating too but not sure if you will see much there.  there is also a opening in the middle as well of the bar section. they also have room for a couple of big groups. I also liked the menu too which is organized by common rolls, rolls without rice, deep fried, and special. You can also make your own roll as well for $15. 

Now onto food. it was pretty good and price isn't bad fro the value that you get. Rolls and nigiri aren't tons of rice with little fish. It's actually just the opposite. We got 

Master Oyster - 2 oysters with uni, fish roe, ponzu sauce, and some green onions. $8 for 2 which isn't too bad. presentation was nice too on the 2 spoons

Poki Salad - this is a mix of tuna, octopus, cucumber, and seaweed salad with the poki sauce. i thought this was a bit small for the price but it was nicely flavored. not too oily and not too bland. 

Sushi Deluxe - For $26, you get a choice of a row between rainbow or red and white, nigiri, AND sashimi. The roll came out smaller than expected but it was rolled with a small amount of rice so not bad. you get a pretty good amount of fish

Chirashi - $16, it comes with salmon, tuna, octopus, egg, white tuna, walu, and fish roe. not bad for the price but the cuts are smaller. I got it with a side salad instead of rice. 

no miso soups with the entrees which should be standard. otherwise not bad. will be back.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: That place is really awesome! Fishes very fresh, nice decoration,and good Service too!
author: Jason H.

description: Got this delivered and it was all delicious. Great flavors. We had some vegetarian rolls, edamame, seaweed salad, and miso soup. The price was reasonable and the food was great. We'd order takeout from here again.
author: Britt C.

description:
My fiance and I had high hopes for Arashi, given so many near 5-star reviews on Yelp. It was just okay.

There are a lot of items on the menu. We ended up getting the chef's special tacos, tuna sashimi, and a couple of rolls since we were trying to eat light. The flavors are pretty good, and the fish tasted fresh. I don't know, we've just had better I guess so nothing wow'd us. The best thing we tasted were probably the tacos.

The decor is drastically different from its predecessor - Rockin' Crawfish. The vibrant graffiti wall is gone, replaced by very zen decor. 

The staff is very friendly and helpful though.
author: Jing D.

description: It's a really good Japanese restaurant the food is great and Service is really good!!
author: Jim K.

description: There is NO Teriyaki sauce on the salmon TERIYAKI. I called and some snooty guy explains that way it's prepared like i'm an idiot. The salmon (which was cold!) is cook in Teriyaki, but they don't no include any sauce. You lost a customer over 10 cents of Teriyaki sauce and a bad attitude.
author: Anthony B.

description: The sashimi and sushi there are SO FRESH! you will know what i mean when you try it! I had the chef's special twice and they didn't let me down. highly recommended the  real wasabi dipping they come with the sashimi!
author: Abby X.

description:
I remember the last we ate at this spot was when Rockin Crawfish was here! So i was really sad when I found out that they had moved to Oakland instead. Anyways my BF bought a Groupon for this place so we decided to eat here for dinner on a Saturday night and brought my mom too since she loves sushi. Keep in mind that parking in this area can be pretty difficult especially on the weekends so you just have to get lucky, which we did but only after circling around a few times. We got seated right away. The menu has a good amount of items on there to choose from and everything sounded pretty tasty. 

We ordered 4 rolls and got complimentary edamame and miso soup. Our rolls came out shortly after we finished our soup. Portions of the rolls was pretty generous and each piece fit nicely into your mouth. Both my BF and I really enjoyed the Giant Roll, which we agreed was both of our favorite roll of the night. The Crunchy Lobster and the Sept Third Roll was just as good also and each roll was very flavorful and distinct in taste. We also got the Wagyu Roll, which doesn't contain any rice but was a little on the plain side for us. The sliced onions was a good compliment with the wagyu beef though. It was great that most of the rolls come with green onion and the orange fish eggs because they really give the rolls texture and flavor! Overall, we were pretty satisfied and was full after 4 rolls. My bf wants to come back again next time to order their real wasabi and some fresh sashimi. So we will be back! :)
author: Mary C.

description: We found different combinations of fishes than you normally see on sushi menus which was fun. The fish was fresh and we enjoyed our first time here.
author: Chi Wai M.

description: The food is fantastic and there is a great variety of sushi. Ingredients are absolutely fresh and everything blends perfectly together. Highly recommend this place for sushi at a reasonable price. Atmosphere was fine, a little noise but I go places for food quality. I will return here!
author: King Y.

description: I like their tempura: crispy but not very oily.  Their non sea weed rolls are fine as well.
author: Edison T.

description: Went here multiple times on weekdays and weeknights. The servers are polite and efficient. The food is also very delicious. I highly recommend the hand rolls such as the traditional Dragon and Spider Rolls. They also know how to make a really good bowl of Udon. The broth and the noodles are delicious. I also recommend to try their sashimi plate. They have a variety to choose from on the menu and the overall environment of this restaurant is relaxing and enjoyable!
author: Angela W.

description: Sashimi that is fresh, amazingly delicious, and presented beautifully. Very friendly staff. We had fresh tako, whole flying fish (first time for everything!), kampachi, ocean trout (soooo good), and the creamiest most flavorful uni! Left very satisfied and already looking forward to returning!
author: Maxine C.

description: The sushi was decent.  I find that the quality of the saba is usually reflective of how good the sushi is overall and it was not as fresh as I would have liked.  It was decent, just not great.  I found that the mixed tempura was a little soggy too.  One tip to the restaurant - put the hot and cold (sushi/sashimi) dishes in separate to-go bags.  I only live a few blocks away and by the time I got home the sushi plate had been heated to at least room temperature by the miso soup that you stacked on top of it.
author: Charles W.

description: Gotta start with the "Beware" first. Got this as delivery via Eat24. Instead of 1 hour delivery, it was over 1.5 hours. Ergo, mushy udon and tempura limper than overcooked spaghetti. That said, the Saka Kama was delicious -- buttery, rich, wonderful. And the fish tacos were banging. So, yeah. I'll be careful about ordering next time. But I will order again.
author: Nini M.

description: Good selection and used Groupon so pricing was cheaper than even the menu.  I went here while my friend let me stow my pug at his house.  Parking was difficult close by, but if you don't mind walking you should be able to get a spot on a side street.  Even though crowded, the waiter was kind and gentle and placed me in a room of my own, window gave view of the street.  Food was consistent with other reviews, had the Tako and Miso soup.  Served hot tea for free and it was good flavor.  Fast service, decent prices so if you are on this side of the peninsula, good place to go if you are in a spot.
author: Leonard P.

description: last night i went to this Japanese restaurant. the decoration and environment are great feel relax.also the food is very special that i have never seen .i can feel the chef make them very seriously. i will go second time for sure
author: Kyle C.

description: When I go to a sushi place, I just eat their raw fish instead off Americanized rolls. So when I get to arashi, I just tried their fresh fish directly. Do you know how much parasites ankimo(monkfish liver) contains before served? Black worms just coming out from those livers. Scary right? But tasty! Good Japanese restaurants serve ankimo because they don't care to pay the labor, but just for good food and good outcome. So arashi pass the first test. My favorites from them are also the salmon belly, hamachi belly and at last the walu(butterfish), they are all just amazing! Melts in you mouth with just a few bites. Love the UNI and they occasionally serve UNI from japan(Hokkaido). Large variety of sake selections and the most important thing, I just live a few blocks from them. Thanks for arashi making my life craving fresh fish easier these days. Love you always!
author: Mandy W.

description:
Yummy sushi and ramen ^_^ 
Great customer service 
I highly recommend Arashi Sushi House
author: G W.

description: This is probably the best sushi place I have ever eaten. It's delicious and the ONLY place that can make me eat salad. Their sushi and udon are so good! My go to sushi place!
author: Kaylie L.

description:
New to the neighborhood and a great addition.
If thet keep doing what they have done on my two visits, they will do well.
author: Joe H.

description:
review number 400!!! whoot whoot!

Thank you groupon! had a great deal for a prix fix menu... miso soup, appetizers (had tempura-not greasy! :)), 2 rolls (of your choosing)! yummy goodness. fresh fish. it's very chill and clean. two things i love about any place.

if you get here early enough on a weekday (4-6) you also get happy hour sushi and sake!

modern decor and helpful staff. good find and would definitely return.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Group of 8 ppl came to this new japanese restaurant tonight, very fresh fish and great service here!  Love the fish taco and lived scallops!  All my friends had a great time here!  Will come back more often
author: Mable L.

description: Sushi was not good .  The uni is totally not fresh and must be the lowest grade uni.  It tasted like burned tires.  I had much better uni.  Fish was smelly and not fresh. I don't know who would give then high reviews
author: Shawn J.

description: Cartilage in chicken and bone in beef. I would've been very disappointed if i didn't have a coupon. Out of our meals of teriyaki and sushi, the only thing that was pretty good was my crunchy california roll.
author: Alyssa T.

description:
I'm so excited that I've found another favorite sushi spot. Tonight is the first time we stopped by this place, it was packed with a lot of people. We were sitting at the bar, we started off with the plum salmon sashimi, after the first bite of the salmon, I fell in love with this dish that I had to order another one. It's just so yummy. We also ordered the sunset roll , and the beef tataki. They all taste very good. Open sashimi order  was fresh off the boat.  
This place isn't too big, but very decent, they also have private room for party up to 14 ppl. I'm definitely  coming back to this place soon!
author: Daiz Z.

description:
We came, we ordered, we loved it. Six of us had a marvelous meal- the sashimi was to die for. 
Before the meal was over we are making plans to return.
Best waiter, great prices.
author: Red J.

description: We ate at their restaurant yesterday. We have ordered 10-11 kinds of nigiri and 6 kinds are from the happy hour menu. We have also order one spicy salmon roll and some of their happy hour oysters. Our waitress is really nice and attentive. When we try their sushi it doesn't taste really fresh. Me and my boyfriend went home both suffering from stomachache and diarrhea for the whole night. I think we got food poisoning. I have to take a day off from work and now deciding if I should go to an ER. 2 stars are only for the attentive waitress.
author: Shelly H.

description: Edamame, rolls, gyoza and tea all amazing! We will be back - delicious and affordable sushi!!!
author: Caroline R.

description: I ordered a Philly, a The Rock, a bowl of miso and a green tea. the Philly was done incorrectly; a correct Philly is SMOKED salmon, cream cheese & avocado. their salmon was not smoked and there was no avocado. the fish on both rolls had a mealy texture and didn't taste fresh but were okay enough to eat (I understand some days are better than others). not enough miso in my bowl. the cup of green tea felt microwaved. these things can't be counterbalanced by having a friendly ultra sexy waitress, but that was nice anyway
author: Loren B.

description: I came here with my boyfriend for dinner, and we bought the Groupon deal. We were amazed by how fresh the Sashimi was. We ordered a soft shell crab for appetizer, 10pcs Sashimi, a Crunchy Lobster roll, and a Wagyu roll. They were so yummy. We especially liked the Wagyu roll. The beef is very tender. Minus the Groupon, we paid another $35 out of pocket. It's not bad at all for a sushi dinner. This is a place to try. If you have Groupon deal, it would be even better. Definitely come back for sushi.
author: May N.

description:
Came back after I got a really good Groupon deal and I had really liked the restaurant the first time. 

However the second time, left me very underwhelmed.

My biggest gripe is the sushi rice and uni. 

The sushi rice did not have enough vinegar flavor and sweetness. All in all it tasted like dull plain white jasmine rice rather than a glossy grained tangy rice.

The uni did not taste fresh. Don't get it. 

The other sashimi pieces were very good but underwhelming compared to my first experience. 

A+ to the service though! The young lady was very courteous and always refilled our tea.
author: Lianna L.

description: Went here on a Friday night. Easy to get a table. Used my Groupon and ordered 4 rolls, garlic edamame and gyoza for around 50 bucks. There was a lot of food between two people! Great service! Would definitely go again!
author: Jenn Z.

description: The restaurant has unassuming entrance but the interior is clean and has a couple of large screen televisions on the walls. The sushi was fresh and menu was diverse. They even have Ramen! The bathrooms were very clean and the service was GREAT! I will be back for sure!!
author: Marisa M.

description: Fresh!!!  And grilled food is good too. Must try. Perfect location to eat, not to hard to looking for parking on Geary.
author: Sara L.

description:
Wow!

My family of four loved the experience of eating here.  The garlic edamame was amazing.  Yum!!!  We enjoyed the taste adventure as we tried the different dishes. The presentation of the courses were thoughtfully arranged with lovely small details that enhanced our experience. 

The staff was down to earth and welcoming.
author: Elaine L.

description: I've only ever gotten delivery from these guys, but talk about being rock solid. Who else can you possibly trust to deliver an amazing omakase meal to your front door? The quality is so much better than your average joint. Also, I asked them, if they had time to give me a list of the fish in the omakase so that I could order in person at some point. I thought it was just going to be a short list, but they totally bowled me over when I received my sushi with little labels taped over each piece on the plastic container. Such an awesome gesture and a testament to the love and detail they have in prepping your food, and it is exactly what makes me order from them all the time.
author: Clarissa S.

description: Very good, fresh sushi place! Their salmon plum sashimi were to die for!  I ll recommend this place!
author: Latefa R.

description: This spot is delicious :) it was a super cold day in SF so the miso soup was a great start. The garlic edamame is a perfect balance without too much garlic. Had the salmon sashimi, rainbow roll and san francisco roll. Great service too! It's a little out of the way for me but it's nice to venture out. Definitely coming back.
author: Amanda L.

description:
The place was clean and pleasant. Food was decent and prices were reasonable. Groupon deal was a steal. 
Garlic edamame, plum sake sashimi, tempura were all good. The rice-less rolls wrapped in cucumber are refreshing, like sushi salad, but don't think I'll get that in the future. 
I don't know why there were not more people there on a weekend night, but that's a plus on my book since I hate long lines for food. Could it be because it is operated by Chinese? I don't mind since I'm no purist and I eat pizza from non-Italian operated businesses.
author: Meimei M.

description: The quality of their fish is questionable; I received a hamachi nigiri that looked jaundice and smelled really weird. I avoided it, but continued to eat around it. After my meal I immediately began feeling the usual symptoms of food poisoning. It's been 4 days and I'm still feverish. My doc said I have an infection in my digestive system. Boo
author: Sarra S.

description: I tried this place three times now & it kept getting worse. Unfortunately the this last time will be just that - last. The eel was good (but very small portions) & the other fish I ordered didn't taste fresh at all. I didn't finish it as I am scared of what my stomach is going to do later. It is cheaper and it was fast delivery but I'd much rather spend a little more and get fresh fish anyday!
author: S. M.

description: I was here on a cold evening when I was just craving for some hot Ramen and since I am vegetarian, I was glad to know they had many options for us as well (not just for Ramen though). We ordered some garlic edamame, asparagus sushi roll, a bowl of rice and veggie tempura, all vegetarian. Everything comes in good quantity and it all costed just $30 (tax/tip exclusive)! and how can I forget that free sake I got with my yelp check in! You can easily find parking around, may be a block down on clement. I am definitely coming back to place!
author: Pratibha S.

description: Came here tonight for my husband's birthday dinner party. Very clean, super friendly, great service &very attentive!!! Food was amazing. We had a party of 6 and used groupon. They honored it and said we can order anything from the menu and they took $30 off a 200 dollar bill. Yay we will be back that's for sure. The mochi ice cream was very chewy tastes really weird wouldn't order it but besides that everything was amazing especially the green tea cheesecake! Can't really complain for the complimentary cheesecake and assorted mochi ice cream simply because it was complimentary for the  birthday boy.
author: Michele T.

description: I love the super dynamite roll, free edamame.big portion of teriyaki salmon,but portion of Raman.overall,my friend and I like this place and will come back!
author: Andy T.

description: The Ramen is delicious. The mochi ice cream wasn't too great. But overall the food is great
author: Mitali G.

description: I really liked the butterfish carpaccio and the salmon sashimi. I used the groupon deal for the restaurant and got a ton of food. There's a set menu for the groupon where you get two soups, two appetizers, and two rolls. The servers we had were very nice and they even taught us how we should eat certain dishes. It was a fun time!
author: Thomas D.

description: It's ok, I've had better.   although delivery is pretty quick through eat24 .  Sushi quality is far from best as someone stated in previous review .  Don't get me wrong  it's ok for a quick bite and for delivery   It's just not ....what I expected
author: Damien F.

description:
Good price. Generous portion. They know where to get really fresh fish too! Love Ankimo and Uni. It was super fresh and sweet! 

The only problem we had was with the maki rolls we got. The quality is about the same with those 'sushi' you can get in Walgreen and 7-11. The rice was overcooked and soggy. the roll was falling apart before anyone touch it. 

Nice and quick service.
author: Bobo V.

description: Mediocre quality of food. Waiter was on phone texting instead of checking on customers. Beware of their LivingSocial deals for this restaurant. They limit  rolls to the cheaper rolls so it wasn't really a deal any more.
author: Hieu P.

description: Best ramen in the Richmond, no question. The sushi is on point too. the new hawt spot. if there was anything better than the orgasm in my mouth, it was the service! I mean the visual, timely, and amazing service almost made me forget about how this food nearly made me scream out in pure passion! ooooooooh! my gosh leg shaking food. an experience in your mouth that level you wanting more.
author: Harry B.

description: I was looking for Japanese food on yelp and "arashi"showed up.then me and my friend decide to try this new restaurant . after I looked at the pictures shows in their business page. I ordered the Omakese sashimi and couple rolls. the sashimi looks pretty fresh and yummy.. and the sever also explain what kind of fish did I get..very friendly service .. and I really like the white out and crunchy lobster roll ..and I heard about their ramen is very famous too..i would back to try their ramen for sure next time .
author: 俊伟

description: this sushi place was really good. We went on Friday night. Make a reservation cause this place gets busy. The food was amazing, presentation beautiful, and the staff was super nice. I will go back。
author: Fanny C.

description: Their ramen are the best! I enjoy the chef choice a lot , they just made my day!
author: Kenny C.

description: I'm a visitor from out of town. The menu looked good so I did the take out. The rice was starchy. Too much rice in the rolls. Every plate and bowl brought to me was dirty or sticky before I even used it. For dessert don't bother with the mochi. It was terrible. The coating tasted freezer burned. So much for convenience.  I will never return.
author: Irma G.

description: Excellent service and food. The service was friendly and attentive, but not obtrusive. The sushi was very good. My seafood udon was excellent. My friend's Saba dish was excellent. My best Groupon experience!
author: Julia R.

description: Our go-to for sushi delivery. Consistently good, fresh food. We love the hamachi kama and salmon teriyaki. The rolls are decent, too. Delivery is quick and prices are reasonable. At the rate we order in from Arashi, I'm bound to give their other dishes a try soon...
author: Brianna M.

description: Solid Japanese/Chinese food.  The beef teriyaki was plentiful and flavorful.  Not a fan of the spider roll--a bit overcooked.
author: C L.

description:
The raw fish is good. I always enjoy the sashimi!!!
The fish taco is my favorite. Hamachikama is delicious too. It is good place for friends and family dining.
author: Connie Y.

description: Love the lobster roll!!! My kids love the California rolls and Tempora udon. The Groupon for $30.00 is a great deal too.
author: cal t.

description:
My GF purchased a Groupon deal:
"$26 for a sushi dinner for two (up to $53 value)

    2 miso soups
    Bowl of garlic edamame
    4 pieces of hiyashi tofu
    4 pieces of mix tempura
    6 pieces of plum sake sashimi
    One roll of choice per person."

What's disappointing about this deal is that you don't get to select rolls from the entire menu list. They give you a restricted Groupon menu with a smaller list of rolls that doesn't include the more expensive rolls as an option. WEAK! They should really just list the Groupon restricted menu on the Groupon page, so buyers can know what they are really purchasing. I took photos and will try to post later. 

In terms of the food, the taste and quality was average. Nothing special as I wished from reading other reviews. The hiyashi tofu dish was cold, bland tasting cubes of tofu that fell apart easily. The tempura was good with the right about of crunchiness, but portion is a lot smaller than other places. The rolls that came with the order were also on the smaller side and the taste was okay. The spider roll could've been better and the Temptation roll wasn't very tempting. We also ordered a sashimi regular dish to go along with the rest of the meal. The sashimi was fresh and tasted about the same as any other place. Menu prices for items are higher than other places of equal or better quality. In the end...I'm left wanting more from this place and my stomach is disappointed.
author: Mike W.

description: Went it today and had a sushi deluxe as well as some sashimi. Fish were amazing and fresh. The server who helped us was very nice and helpful. Overall a great experience.
author: Mark K.

description:
this is more of a 3.5 review.

checked it out due to a groupon deal. it was a prix fix menu that was barely enough food for us (2). 

there's a lot of rice on the rolls and it was mediocre.
the agadashi was pretty good.
the tempura was good (you can't really mess that up unless it comes out soggy)

so it was a mediocre experience. unfortunately for this place, there are many other japanese restaurants in the same area so i'll be going to the other places.

but i'm glad i got the group to check it out.
author: Vanae W.

description: We stopped by for dinner because of their groupon deal that was $26 and suppose to be worth around  $53 worth of food. The deal was very misleading because it was a set menu SHARED between two people when i thought we each would get our own. Our dinner came with miso soup, a bowl of edamame, cold tofu (tasted like they just took a carton of tofu out of the fridge and poured some soy sauce on it), tempura that came with two broccolis, shrimp, and two green beans, two sushi rolls, and six pieces of sake sashimi. We chose a spider roll and one of their specialty rolls and they both only came with 4-5 pieces... The only good part was the sashimi (which they were not going to serve us until I showed her the groupon deal on my phone which listed all the item included).  The sake sashimi was served with some kind of sauce, sriracha, and a jalapeño. It wasn't like anything we've ever tried before.  Items on the menu were pretty pricey for the amount of food you get... And yes we left hungry. I guess for $26 it was ok, definitely not worth $53 tho.
author: Linz C.

description: Mediocre salmon teriyaki ,mediocre sashimi sake. Service was a mediocre at best after getting the salmon teriyaki order wrong followed by a 20 minute delay to get the order corrected. Prices are reasonable.
author: Michael P.

description: this place is okay. their service was good, but i ordered a couple of different rolls and got a stomachache afterwards. i think if i'm in the area, i'd to give it another try, but there are so many other choices, so we'll see.
author: Mike C.

description: Took an hour and a half to be delivered the wrong items, which were soggy and inedible. Staff wouldn't do anything about it and said manager would call me back but that hasn't happened.
author: Erica R.

description:
Came here on the $26 for $53 Groupon dinner.

We didn't finish most of the appetizers, which includes edamame(too buttery), hiyashi tofu(bland), tempura, and miso soup.  The sashimi was all right, and the sushi rolls we ordered (spicy tuna, temptations) were good.  Their hot tea tasted like plain hot water.

The value of the Groupon offer is lacking, but as it's close to us, we may come back just to try out more sushi options and see if it's a better deal.
author: daphne w.

description: Found this place on Yelp while looking for Sushi places in the area. Menu prices looked reasonable and the pics looked good. I was looking for a place that offered a Sashimi sampler for $20 or less. Price for a 10pc Sashimi Sampler was only $16.95. Also ordered the Sushi Regular (5pc with CA roll. Very reasonable price. Relatively large pieces of fish which were really fresh tasting. Surrounding area looked a little dodgy because of the motel and massage place next door. Interior was nice and clean looking. More modern than Japanese looking. Service was quick and efficient. Will have to return to try other things on the menu.
author: Ronald C.

description:
Nice place, good atmosphere,Fresh!
I have come back there three times,it means i like it:)
author: Armand A.

description: I love this sushi place. It is really nice and they usually have a groupon so it's a really great deal. He service is nice and the rolls are HUGE ! Considering how the big the rolls are they are really well priced. So worth it. Also, I order delivery from them regularly and it's good. That's saying a lot because finding a good sushi delivery is almost impossible.
author: Lauren M.

description: Consistently delicious rolls. Great appetizers (the salmon with jalapeño is our favorite). Servers are incredibly attentive and very helpful! Great little hidden gem :)
author: Tori M.

description: I love this place , affordable and awesome service ^^! The interior is quite small but provided a really warm atmosphere also the music  they play there is nice too. I went in yesterday with my boyfriend we had some beer to start off with. The service was amazing, our waitress kept checking in on us and quick to punch in our order, most importantly she was smiley and didn't rush us when it past their closing time. Anyways we ordered some uni nigiri, which was really fresh no bitter taste to it it was sweet. We also ordered the regular oysters and oyster shooters. Im an oyster fanatic and i just wanna say they have like the most perfect size oysters ever (cause i like them tiny) even my boyfriend who doesn't eat oysters much ate a lot that day. We ordered the plum salmon sashimi, tasted really unique cant describe it but its pretty amazing. Btw the food came out pretty fast so im glad. We decided to order some sake midway of our dinner, even though theyre almost about to close they still let me which is a double plus plus ! Anyways ordered two rolls and also the hamachi carpaccio. The rolls has a nice presentation tasted fine no rice or the filling falling out. Aside from the oysters the hamachi carpaccio is my favorite! It was so fresh, flavorful, and melty , absolutely my favorite. I am definitely coming back here next time with pictures taken!
author: Jenny L.

description: My new favorite sushi restaurant. Amazing tuna 'tacos' that you'll want more than one order FOR sure. Love the Hollywood roll. Blue tuna toro is insanely fresh and buttery. Sashimi and nigiri won't disappoint. Loveeee this place and the service is always great and very accommodating
author: Sarah A.
