description: Sushi for days and it was heaven!! We had a group of four and had a group dinner and split everything, they have a half off saki for yelp check in, and took groupons! It was ammmaaazing!!!
author: Kylie W.

description: Excellent food, service and prices.  Complementary Edamame as soon as we got a table. We ate around 5:30pm and took advantage of some happy hour prices.  $3  California rolls, gyosa, skewered chicken and a whole bunch more.  Our table also ordered  salmon and chicken teriyaki that came with rice, a salad and a bowl of miso soup for just over $9 each.  I ordered a tuna/avocado roll and the tuna was excellent.  The dining room is clean and is a comfortable place to enjoy dinner.
author: Toni M.

description:
I am a big fan of Japanese food,  and I like to bring my family to different style of Japanese restaurant all over the San Francisco Bay Area. Arashi Sushi is, by far, the great place to go. 
I have only been here twice at lunch, and both of the lunch service are exceptional. The server is very sweet and caring. The pork of their Tonkotsu Ramen is superb, very tender & flavorful. I also like their sushi,  fish are all super fresh and yummy, and their sushi presentation is artistic! 
I'll definitely come back here again with my family if I'm in the area.
author: Jackie C.

description: Le bf and I come with the Groupon deal like everyone else. Long story short, the rolls have way too much sauce, and the sashimi was ... Interesting. We also order the ankimo in addition to our set meal, and it was not bad. Would we come back again? Probably not.
author: Wendy T.

description:
if i can give them a 0, i would.  but you know how yelp is. we decided to try this place, ordered simple roll, 2 nigiri.  we are maybe 10 mins away from them, took almost an hour for delivery.  the guys came and the box was all tilted. when we opened it, the roll and nigiri was all over the place, there's sauce on the roll.  AND the nigiri wasn't what we ordered. called the restaurant right away, the women on the phone is speaking chinese to the delivery, to the manager and when i said, don't make another one, just cancel and refund.  we've already waited an hour, not going to wait for another 30 min to get food.  she first tells me, they can't do that.  then she's talking to the manager saying not sure if i'm lying about the wrong order.  

hello!  do you not know what you made and didn't make?  thank god i took pictures.  when i said i'll send the picture back, she immediately said no no, we'll refund.  

just to make sure, called grub hub and told them as well to make sure i get refunded.  crazy way to do business and terrible customer service.  tons of sushi places in this area, never try this again.
author: Silver C.

description: So freaking amazing!!!!!!love it so much...the freshness & quality of sashimi is top notch. Every dish is carefully thought out and  beautifully presented...anyway. Juz one word that I can say... ((((Amazing)))......
author: Jenicababy L.

description: This is the second time I come here and the fish selection is more than the first time, and I think I over ordered a little bit but no regret. I cannot remember all the fish I ordered but they are all fresh, I think that's good enough.
author: Edmond W.

description: Had the best fish dish at Arashi Sushi House. Really fresh fish, loved the red snapper, てんぷら、and ウニ. Definitely  need to go there with friends again. Good for party and group. めっちゃ美味しかった。
author: Jing F.

description: First rate experience from the time we were seated to the time we left. We were served green tea with roasted rice as soon as we were seated...very good tea. We ordered shrimp tempura and gyoza to start. The tempura was light and delicate and the gyoza was very tasty. We were served edamame and miso soup as part of the meal, we were not expecting that...it was a pleasant surprise. For our main meal, we had Tonkatsu with curry and Chad ramen. The servings were generous and the taste was authentic and delicious. A very good value. Would go back again for sure and would highly recommend it to anybody. BTW....never given a restaurant review before...felt I had to for this place.
author: Lilibeth A.

description: An hour late with delivery. The tofu in the miso was microscopic. The ramen was very bland. The only thing that was just ok was the sushi roll and that was by far way too small for $12. I will not be ordering from them again.
author: Katie S.

description: Dining in was pretty good. The sushi was better than expected, and I am now a returning customer if I crave sushi around the area!
author: Eric H.

description: I walk in here with my girlfriend last saturday. We got seated right away in a timely manner!! We ordered the omakase with special that we never heard of. If you love sushi this is a must have! Service is fast and great!! We will definitely repeat.
author: Yogotti J.

description: Coming from dusty old Butte county in Northern California, I don't get to enjoy such delicious ramen and sushi often. This place was fantastic both times I went. Friendly and helpful staff. Lost one star for timing, had to wait a while while for my wife's food to eat. Go to this restraint, it's great.
author: Arnold D.

description: This might be my new favorite sushi place in the neighborhood. We had a delicious sashimi plate and a couple great rolls.
author: Brian M.

description: This place is amazing! The kar-age ramen is great and also the night roll. The staff was friendly helped with any questions. A must check if you're in the area. 2 thumbs up!
author: Ted H.

description:
Just pass by and noticed this is a new sushi restaurant here, walked in with my girl friend to see how is this place.

We ordered 
Omakaze sushi--came with 6 pcs sushi with $17.95, I asked what kind of fish on that, the chef told me all the name but I could not remember any1 of them because I have never seen or heard of them, the chef said he will have a box of fish delivered from japan every week and weekly different! That is soooo cool at that point . Also the flavor was yumyum!

September 3rd-- shrimp tempura and avocado inside top with seared scallop, hummm I felt like okay with this roll, not thing special. 

Chashu ramen-- recommended! I mean I like the soup, they told me that was home made ramen soup, strong flavor! I like the soup more then the noodle lolz. They told me the chashu is home made as well, taste okay.

Mix tempura-- 2 shrimps and 6 pcs of vegetable, not thing different from other restaurant. The shrimp was a bit over fried I think. 

The serve here was good , friendly even tho they have Chinese accent, but that was totally cool. 

The construction is ordinary but the place is clean. 

I will give this place 4 starts. Will come back next time;):)
author: John W.

description: The tasting menu was incredible. The staff were kind, helpful, nd knowlwdgable. Would def come again and again. There are few places with better prices. With several nice tv's it's currently a wonderful place to watch a Sunday or Monday night game.
author: Ashur B.

description:
Came here the other night with bunch of friends. We all lived close by and just decided to try this new place out. 

And it was surprisingly good, excellent service. All their staff greeted us with a big smile right when we walked in. Fish was fresh and portion was good too compared to prices

Highly recommended and will definitely be my usual sushi spot from now on
author: Ivan T.

description: Ordered through Grubhub and it took about an hour to arrive. We got Unagi Don &  Katsu. We actually thought they were the best Japanese delivery food we've had so far in SF.
author: Christina C.

description: Incredibly fresh fish.  My chirashi order wasn't huge but best quality I've had, and I've had a lot of sushi.
author: Julia C.

description: The omakase sashimi is amazing, it comes with all the fresh daily special fishes, and the blue fin tuna toro is best of the best, i will be back for sure!
author: Chris H.

description: Another 5 stars for this place. Came with a larger group this time and looks like they upped their game with complimentary salad and edamame now. Food is also on different plates and even better presented than last time when I came. These simple things make for some great customer experience. Keep it up guys!
author: Kyle Z.

description: Amazing food ... Fresh and authentic. ! Friendly staff- good service / "I'll be back "
author: Lee A.

description: Poor service, unprofessional attitude treating a groupon voucher customer, lack of knowledge, charged tax on groupon and charged sales tax on top of groupon tax. Food wasn't the best, just simple fried food with grocery store sauce. Nothing unique, lots of restrictions on the selections of the rolls you can select from, it's the lowest grade and value from the menu and does not add up to the actual retail value they declared for party of two or four. There's much more better options else where in that neighborhood.  Service wasn't attentive, you have to ask for it, and the server who was the host was constantly doing personal things, eg. Starring at the smart phones...
author: M W.

description:
If I can give it a 0, I would and they deserve it.
Went there for a quiet Friday night dinner with two kids and my wife. Had Groupon deal like everyone else.
Groupon deal I super misleading and confusing. Good luck understanding what to order from the menu. 

Since we didn't quite understand...

Waitress was rude to my wife when ordering.

The edamame with garlic was super soggy. Tofu was decent, tempura was good. The sushi took FOREVER to come out. They clearly forgot about my nigiri I ordered as well as the salmon sashimi. 35 minutes into the appetizer, we're like 'where the hell is the real food?'

Manager comes in to apologize, I ask for our food. He comes back later and says 'sorry, out of the frozen Saba, would you like a fresh one?' I say ok, that takes another 10 minutes to serve? Why didn't they tell me ahead of time? One piece had wasabi underneath the Saba, the other did not..how odd. It was not good.

The waiter/manager even said he'll charge me normal price for fresh Saba nigiri..nope..10 Bucks my wife said afterwards..

They knew we were getting mad, so the waitress said 'dessert is free, I'll be right back' 15 minutes later, I had enough and walked out with my son while my wife stayed with the younger one. Horrific service.

Just asked her (a day later) 'how was the free dessert?' She scoffed at me and said 'they never gave it to us!'

She had to walk out of the room to just ask for the check. Sad.

Only thing good was that we had a semi-private room facing Geary street. It was peaceful since both kids are so loud.

Overall, HORRIBLE service, mediocre food. Would not recommend, even if the groupon deal looks appealing. I'd rather eat mall sushi.
author: G L.

description: it's so nice to find a dining experience with deliciou food,best omakase sashimi.we ordered soup,a few appetizers and omakase sashimi plate all to share and it was plenty and satisfying.we will definitely be back again!
author: Fion T.

description: A group of friends and I decided to celebrate a birthday and it was the best decision! The food was fantastic with good portions and the service was phenomenal!! I highly recommend trying them out, definitely one of my new favorite sushi spots!
author: Meghan J.

description: Amazing spot and very reasonably priced! I've had sushi all over the world, and this was hands down some of the best I've ever had. Had the spicy tuna and sake avo roll.
author: Blake S.

description: I have been wanting to come in and try the sushi since Arashi opened up less than 4 mos ago.  The former place, a crawfish restaurant, did not last very long. You know, there are a lot of sushi restaurants in the inner Richmond. I ordered the Foxy roll off their "Rolls with us" section. Amazing. eel, avo, mango, topped with tuna, white tuna, white tuna, and tobiko. You have the salty, sour, sweet combo. The tiny little Flying Fish eggs added a delicious crunchiness to each bite. Yowza! And affordable too.
author: Jewli J.

description:
The food was tasty and fresh, the restaurant was clean with nice ambiance, the service was pleasant, and the prices were a good value.

The food exceeded my expectations for the price point and everything was very fresh.  I went with my mother, who generally hates to try different kinds of food, and she enjoyed it as well.

I tried the three item lunch special with two nigiri rolls and the vegetable tempura, all of which were great.  Some other reviewers have commented on the service being slow and it wasn't for me and my family, but I could definitely see that the one waiter working that day was on the inexperienced side, so experiences with the service may vary as the wait staff become more seasoned.
author: Johnson L.

description: Been here once. Recent discovery. Food and service were great. Servers were really polite and attentive. Will definitely come back again. Love this place.
author: Helen L.

description: i'm  here again at arashi i sushi hause...with there best sushi...best food  and costumer  service....5 stars from me...try it and you will love it..
author: Dennis B.

description: The living social deal is a total steal!! For $25, you get garlic edamame, miso soup, a tofu appetizer, shrimp/veggie tempura, salmon sashimi and 2 rolls of your choice. This is the first time we left sushi super stuffed! The waiter was also really friendly and attentive. My only complaint was that the sushi was pretty salty.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Prefix meal from Living Social. Service was good. Roll has large selection. All white roll was very good. Lobster roll and Salmon sashimi were good too but the flavor was too strong to me. Free hot sake with yelp check in. Would come back.
author: Mason Y.

description: Ordered delivery.  They were an hour late and didn't get the order right.  The fish was tough.  I ordered a mushroom skewer that was supposed to come with daikon and ponzu sauce. They gave me four very sad, very soggy, and very naked looking mushrooms.
author: Hanah C.

description: Sushi is easily my favorite food; one might call me a sushi connoisseur. I've eaten here twice and absolutely love the service, quality of the fish, and variety of rolls. HIGHLY RECOMMEND EATING HERE.
author: Brooke L.

description: Hippy is great!  The food was awesome and we really had a great meal. We highly recommend you to check it out!!  See you there!
author: Bob J.

description: It's not very professional for sushi making and I order the uni. It taste not very fresh. The food is  expensive  but I did Not get a very good quality of the food.
author: Linruo Z.

description: Reading some of the other reviews of this restaurant makes me wonder whether those diners visited the same restaurant I did.  I have eaten at literally hundreds of sushi restaurants across the world and this place is in my top three.  I ordered the Chef's Omakase and got eight incredible nigiri (including salmon belly, blue shrimp and baby lobster) for $24.  In NY, that same selection would have cost me at least $40 -- in Tokyo, $60 -- and I would have had trouble even finding the blue shrimp.  This is not your run of the mill Cal. roll kind of place, but if you want gourmet sushi at a reasonable price, this is the real deal.
author: James R.

description: Age dashi was a 3. Spicy tuna and spicy salmon rolls average. Ika nigiri average. Hotate sashimi was a 4.
author: LT B.

description: A really delightful gem in the Richmond! The staff is super polite and efficient. I stop in here after work for udon and maki and I've been consistently happy with the quality of the food and you can't beat the price. I highly recommend this place!
author: Kate S.

description: so amazing！i like it 。。next time i will bring my gf to there agian！all food are good，almost drunk at the day
author: Jiedong L.

description: We visited it today with a Groupon ($15 for $30 dinner). We ordered white out roll, fish tacos and two ramen (char-shu with pork flavor and chicken kara-age with pork flavor). Everything tasted awesome and fresh. Great deal with groupon!
author: Quan D.

description: I really enjoy Japanese food and found that this place had taken the spot from Rockin Crawfish, so I decided to check the place out. First off I had an ankimo appetizer and it was above par. I asked and found out that they actually taken fresh out of the fish and prepared instead of the packaged ones that people serve elsewhere. Would highly recommend. Then I came around to the sashimi and one really cannot go wrong here, and as expected it did not go wrong and went great. At the end of the day this is a great place to add to my list of places to return to.
author: Raymond Y.

description: I went with friends for dinning at this sushi place. All i can say is their food is incredibly fresh! That is all it needs for a sushi place! Highly recommended.
author: Arvin L.

description: I came in with a livingsocial deal to try out this new place and it was a great experience. I came in time for happy hour and they have a good amount of items to choose from for happy hour. The $1 oysters were better than usual from other places. The quality of the nigiri is good for price point. The only drawback really was the tea which tasted like hot water only. Overall I think I would come again since service was great and prices were good.
author: Catherine P.

description: Very friendly staff, excellent quality and generous portions. Great value for the money. A must try for casual dining.
author: Gralen B.

description: Excellent service, great atmosphere, excellent, fresh fish. They have the staple rolls that you'll find anywhere but also really inventful, thought-filled rolls as well. Try the fiesta roll. It's a great combination of flavor.
author: Robin S.

description: Pretty low quality sushi. Ordered delivery. Miso soup arrived cold. But the major bummer was no soy sauce! Come on now!
author: Ali M.

description: So I love this place.  Got a deal of living social and figured "ehh, typical sushi dive with same old, same old." I was pleasantly surprised by their new twist on traditional food. Starting with the garlic edamame, nice change up.  The sushi was fresh and bursting with flavor. The spice tuna was not spicy enough but hey that is what Siracha sauce is for.  They had the best tempura ever.  Given my mother is from Japan and it is a household staple in my family, all tempura is common at best.  But theirs was magical.  Their ingredients fresh and cooked just right. Bravo.  5 stars is for perfection so I took it down 1.  Attentiveness was great, always filling water and taking dirty dishes away quickly.  But the table they seated us at needed to be cleaned when we sat down and food bits flew everywhere with the towel they used.  We asked for Sirach but they forgot so we had to go get it ourselves. But these would be my only complaint.  The no carb sushi choices were interesting and even tasty.....but me thinks me likes my rice.
author: Marcia P.

description: Very Good Sushi~ Very Reasonable Price. Got to try the Tempura Mushroom and the Fish Taco. All the fish are fresh. The Omakase have All the special fish in it. Uni is also very good. 5 Stars no questions.
author: Evan P.

description: holy crap! this is the worst trained staff I have ever dealt with.  my app of oysters came  when I was through my main course. the soup came same time as the main course and had waitress standing 3 feet away with crossed arms waiting for us to finish.please don't even try the groupon deal.  really really really!!!  its not worth it! then the bill says you should tip 25 bucks!! sorry.    BAD DEAL!
author: Fritz S.

description: This newly opened restaurant in Geary st is really amazing. One of the best service and great food. Good location. Interior is really nice. I loved their sushi combo.
author: Yu S.

description: Another horrible wannabe japanese sushi restaurant in the richmond district. I dont understand why people think anyone can just open up a shitty sushi restaurant and expect people to pay a high price for horrible food. Arashi sushi house is another horrible addition to the cluster-fuck of bad restaurants in the richmond. The Gf and i ordered 5 dishes and each one were complete let down.  First off, the tako sunomono was just plain disgusting, it literally tasted like the frozen octopus you get at the asian super market ( im pretty sure it is from a shitty asian market ). The octopus was still frozen in the middle and the cucumbers we butchered in all different sizes which made it unpleasant to eat. There was almost no dressing so it just tasted like a frozen bland bowl of crap. The hamachi carpaccio was fishy and hard to stomach. The spider and hollywood was boring and plain. The sushi rice was mushy and tasteless. The mixed tempura's batter was hard and dense. i really dont know how and why this place has four and half stars on yelp, but im pretty sure as time goes on this place's rating will drop. And like the business that was previously there before, i wouldn't be surprised if this place closes its door for good within a year or two. I will never come back here and i advise anyone else thinking about trying this place not to come here.
author: R S.
